title: Where Theres Smoke, There Are the Traffic Reporters of Los Angeles
description: Flying high above the fires charging across Los Angeles on Thursday afternoon, Mark Kono, an airborne traffic reporter, noticed that the 101 freeway was suddenly crammed with cars.

title: The First Photos of a Pearl Harbor Warships Watery Grave
description: Nearly 73 years after the Ward, an American navy destroyer, was attacked by Japanese kamikaze planes and sank in waters off the Philippines, a team aboard the research and exploration vessel Petrel gathered anxiously, all eyes fixed on screens in front of them.

title: Micro Units That Come With a Lending Library
description: With a nod to the millions of New Yorkers who live alone, studio apartments of less than 400 feet are setting new standards for efficiency. Now tiny living has arrived at the Brooklyn Cultural District with Caesura, a mixed-used building developed by Jonathan Rose Companies. It is a project of New Yorks Department of Housing Preservation and Development, with 40 percent below-market-rate apartments.

title: Olympic Athletes From Russia, and the Politics of What Theyll Wear
description: The decision by the International Olympic Committee to ban Russia from the 2018 Winter Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea, for widespread doping, but to allow vetted individual athletes to compete on a case-by-case basis as Olympic athletes from Russia has seemingly raised as many questions as it has answered. Among them: What in the world will they wear?

title: Southern California Fires Live Updates: Were Not Out of the Woods Yet
description: VENTURA, Calif.  The quick-moving fires that have forced thousands of Californians to evacuate their homes swept across the southern part of the state on Friday, destroying buildings and taxing fire crews that have been working for days.

title: How Some States Are Helping First-Time Home Buyers
description: Efforts to help potential first-time home buyers save for down payments using special tax-favored accounts have been gaining traction in state legislatures.

title: Jane Krakowski Tap, Tap, Taps Into A Christmas Story Live!
description: It turns out that Jane Krakowski, the object of countless fans adoration, still gets star-struck herself. There she was, in rehearsals for A Christmas Story Live!, when Peter Billingsley  forever Ralphie, dreaming that Santa might deliver a Red Ryder air rifle in the classic 1983 movie  arrived on the Los Angeles set.

title: Review: The Haywire Hospitality of At Home With Amy Sedaris
description: The first episode of At Home With Amy Sedaris makes clear that this is not going to be business  or rather, home economics  as usual.

title: Facts Have a Well-Known Liberal Bias
description: There are two central facts about 21st-century U.S. politics. First, we suffer from asymmetric polarization: the Republican Party has become an extremist institution with little respect for traditional norms of any kind. Second, mainstream media  still the source of most political information for the great majority of Americans  havent been able to come to grips with this reality. Even in the age of Trump, they try desperately to be balanced, which in practice means bending over backwards to say undeserved nice things about Republicans and take undeserved swipes at Democrats.

title: How to Avoid a White-Knuckle Drive on Black Ice
description: What two words can inspire more fear in drivers in wintertime than mixed precipitation?

title: Tracking Dolphins With Algorithms You Might Find on Facebook
description: Keeping track of dolphins is a slippery, patchy process. First, you must procure time on a ship or aircraft, which is expensive. After that, what you see depends on uncontrollable factors like weather, ocean conditions and whether the creatures happen to be hanging out at the seas surface.

title: How to Build a Gingerbread House
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: How Roy Moore Survives
description: Mobile, Ala.  In a curious way, the sex-abuse allegations against Roy Moore, the Alabama Republican Senate candidate, may actually be helping his campaign.

title: From Bylines to Bylaws, Laura Curran Makes Leap to Politics
description: BALDWIN, N.Y.  It may seem odd that for someone whose name has graced the byline of more than 900 articles in two New York City tabloids, one of Laura Currans first acts as Nassau County executive will effectively strip away credit for her new title.

title: Want to Pamper Your Holiday Guests? Make Gougres
description: Caviar and truffles are all well and good, but nothing says Im pampering my guests quite like a tray of hot, crisp gougres straight from the oven.

title: An Economist Explains: How to Sort Facts From Fictions
description: In public debates about economic policy, it can be hard to separate real insights from political posturing. But a few simple rules of thumb can help.

title: Not All Men Are Monstrous
description: Last month, Sunday Review published an essay by Stephen Marche, The Unexamined Brutality of the Male Libido, that drew more than 1,500 responses on the Times site. Mr. Marche is addressing some of those comments here; they have been edited for length and clarity.

title: Johnny Hallydays Fans Share Their Favorite Songs
description: Johnny Hallyday, who died this week, was loved by millions of fans around the world, but mostly in France. His body will travel down the Champs Elyses on Saturday, as part of a funeral procession involving hundreds of bikers. Large crowds are expected to attend and the French President, Emmanuel Macron, will speak at the funeral service.

title: Review: The Radiant Modesty of Janine Jansen at Carnegie Hall
description: The violinist Janine Jansen plays with a kind of radiant modesty. Its no surprise that while she is celebrated in Europe, she has never been fully on the radar here in the United States: There is even to her virtuosity a restraint, an inwardness, that separates her from the sunny showboats who tend to become American stars.

title: Actually, You Do Want to Know How This Sausage Gets Made
description: When you slice into a salami, you are enjoying the fruits of some very small organisms labor.

title: A Reporter Returns to Southern Illinois to Talk About Life, Immigration, Coal
description: Update: Read about our event in West Frankfort, Ill. on Dec. 14.

title: How Andy Dunn of Bonobos Tackles His Workday
description: As the founder and chief executive of Bonobos, Andy Dunn, 38, lives the hectic life of an entrepreneur. From back-to-back meetings to tracking his Fitbit, Mr. Dunn has been trying to carve out more me time. Here is his (not always successful) strategy for balancing life and work.

title: You Have Questions About The Room. Tommy Wiseau Has Answers, Kind Of.
description: Its hard to watch The Room without being left with some questions. Perhaps they are tearing you apart.

title: Official Toll in Puerto Rico: 64. Actual Deaths May Be 1,052.
description: Officially, 64 people died because of the storm, but an analysis by The New York Times suggests that the actual number is substantially higher.

title: Lost in Translation? Pope Ponders an Update to Lords Prayer
description: ROME  It has been a question of theological debate and liturgical interpretation for years, and now Pope Francis has joined the discussion: Does the Lords Prayer, Christendoms resonant petition to the Almighty, need an update?

title: France Investigates Lafarge Executives for Terrorist Financing
description: PARIS  The former chief executive of LafargeHolcim, the worlds largest cement maker, and five other top officials are being formally investigated as part of a government inquiry into whether the company helped finance the Islamic State militant group and other armed factions while operating a factory in Syria.

title: Blinded by Her Husband, She Fights for Justice (and Aces Law School)
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  During the summer break from her graduate studies in Canada, Rumana Monzur returned home to Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, to tell her husband she wanted a divorce. He reacted with leaden silence.

title: Whats New on Netflix, HBO and Amazon Prime This Weekend
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.

title: Trump Says Wells Fargo Fines Will Not Be Reduced
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump warned on Friday that Wells Fargo could face severe penalties for mistreatment of its customers and dismissed reports that the new leadership at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will go easy on banks.

title: Sugary Diet During Pregnancy May Increase Asthma Risk in Children
description: Women who consume lots of sugar during pregnancy may increase the risk for asthma in their children, researchers report.

title: The Polish Parliament Reshapes Courts, Drawing Criticism
description: WARSAW  Polands Parliament on Friday adopted widely condemned legislation to reshape the countrys courts, shrugging off criticism from the European Union and local opponents that the measures would threaten the rule of law and place judges more firmly under government control.

title: A Spinach Lasagna Worthy of a Holiday Feast
description: Some pasta dishes are a breeze to make. Lasagna is not, and there is no getting around it. But it is absolutely worth the effort. Having a companion in the kitchen makes the process go much faster.

title: Why Is Fashion Having an Astral Moment?
description: If anyone can restore proper awe to the notion of space travel, Buzz Aldrin can. At 87, Mr. Aldrin, who made history in 1969 when he set foot on the moon, has hung on to his plain-as-folk charm and easy, infectious enthusiasm.

title: Germany Inches Closer to a New, Old Government
description: BERLIN  Germany inched toward a new government on Friday, as leaders from the center-left Social Democrats, the previous partners of Chancellor Angela Merkels conservative bloc, agreed to sit down next week for exploratory talks on resuming the arrangement.

title: Cobbling Together a Christmas Music Marathon
description: This week brought one of those mini-festivals that seem to sprout periodically in New Yorks classical music ecosystem: four evenings of choral music tied to the Christmas season.

title: Why Russia Tried to Cheat Its Way to Glory
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  What do you think about your new president  you are shocked?

title: Jacqueline Woodson to Explore Belonging in Two Upcoming Books
description: In her National Book Award-winning memoir in verse Brown Girl Dreaming, Jacqueline Woodson hones in on the idea that dialogue inspires understanding; throughout the book, Ms. Woodson urges readers, over and over, to listen. This and several other themes are picked up in two upcoming books by Ms. Woodson: a middle-grade novel called The Dream of America, and a picture book called The Day You Begin. They will be published in August.

title: Berlins State Opera Has Served Kings, Presidents and Dictators. Now What?
description: BERLIN  Since its founding, the Berlin State Opera has lived through a monarchy, two republics and two dictatorships. It is used to strong leaders. On Thursday, when the institution celebrated its 275th birthday with a concert in its newly renovated theater on this citys central Unter den Linden boulevard, it did so against the backdrop of a new situation: political limbo.

title: Environmentalists Ask: Is Indias Government Making Bad Air Worse?
description: NEW DELHI  As millions of Indians watched a televised cricket match this week between the national teams of India and Sri Lanka, the game suddenly stopped.

title: A Tour of Bill Whitakers High-Rise Living Room in Harlem
description: Bill Whitaker

title: The Last Civic Remnant of Authentic Spirituality at Christmastime
description: MESSIAH The Composition and Afterlife of Handels Masterpiece By Jonathan Keates Illustrated. 165 pp. Basic Books. $25.

title: At Least 15 U.N. Peacekeepers Are Killed in Congo
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations said on Friday that at least 15 peacekeepers, all from Tanzania, were killed in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo by militant extremists. It was the deadliest assault on the organizations peacekeeping forces in nearly a quarter century.

title: As Fighting Fades in N.H.L., Panthers Haley Survives on His Other Skills
description: Nearly seven years have passed since the wild night at Nassau Coliseum in February 2011 when Micheal Haley, a 24-year-old Islanders rookie called up that morning from the minor leagues, scored his first N.H.L. goal. Almost as memorable: He got into three fights that game.

title: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC
description: The feminist bimonthly magazine Bust has been around since 1993, emerging from a culture embracing riot grrrl bands and, to a lesser extent, Jane Pratts seminal girl-centric teenage publication Sassy. Part of Busts tradition  besides its downtown cultural sensibility, D.I.Y. ethos and enlightened political consciousness  is the Craftacular, a riot of music, indie shopping (as Bust puts it) and progressive attitude. Begun 12 years ago as a holiday event in Brooklyn, the Craftacular has expanded to other seasons, and to cities like London, Boston and Los Angeles.

title: Kaepernick vs. the N.F.L.: A Primer on His Collusion Case
description: As protests by N.F.L. players during the national anthem seem to have settled down, the grievance case against the league by the man who started it all, the former San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick, is proceeding.

title: A New York Hotel Thats a Destination for Design
At Columbia, Three Women, 30 Years and a Pattern of Harassment
description: The three stories are nearly identical. A young woman arrives at Columbia University for her doctoral studies, eager to prove herself as a scholar. A star professors attentions seem to indicate she has succeeded. The attentions soon turn sexual, and the student grows uncomfortable. But she feels powerless to speak out.

title: Dylan Farrow, Woody Allens Accuser, Says #MeToo Movement Is Selective
description: Dylan Farrow, the adopted daughter of Woody Allen who has alleged that he sexually abused her as a child, questioned in an article published this week why Mr. Allen had escaped the consequences of the widespread social backlash that was set off by the fall of the Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.

title: Trump Rallies a Florida Crowd in Support of an Alabama Senate Candidate
description: PENSACOLA, Fla.  President Trumps crowd was here in Florida on Friday night, but his audience was in Alabama.

title: In Coco, Death Is the Point
description: You may remember the first time you saw a movie character die. Theres probably an entire generation still scarred after a stampede killed Mufasa in The Lion King or Little Foots mother died trying to save him from a Sharptooth in The Land Before Time. And no matter how many times I watch it, I still tear up in the first minutes of Pixars Up, when Carl loses his beloved wife.

title: Dina Powell, Influential Foreign Policy Adviser, Is Set to Exit White House
description: WASHINGTON  Dina H. Powell, a deputy national security adviser to President Trump and one of the most influential women in the Trump administration, will step down early next year, the White House said on Friday.

title: The One Claim That Rodchenkov, Doping Whistle-Blower, Retracts
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  Various sports officials and antidoping investigators have drawn far-reaching conclusions based on the claims made by Grigory Rodchenkov, Russias former top sports chemist.

title: Golden State Warriors Go-to Guy Doesnt Play a Minute
description: NEW ORLEANS  Late in the fourth quarter of the Golden State Warriors game against the New Orleans Pelicans on Monday night, Eric Housen sensed that something was amiss as he sorted through gear in the visiting locker room at the Smoothie King Center.

title: Jackson Had a Great Year, but Mayfield Will Win the Heisman
description: Lamar Jacksons 2017 might have been better than his 2016.

title: A Polite Drive for Secession in Radio Free Vermont
description: Peculiar, impractical and illegal though it may be, secession has its enthusiasts in a surprising number of states. Just last year, Texas Republicans voted on whether to include an endorsement of independence in their party platform (they didnt); this year, there have already been three attempts in California at a Calexit, though its probably more viable as a Scrabble word than a political objective.

title: The Playlist: Seun Kuti and Santana Sound an Alarm, and 10 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. This week, Brandi Carlile explores motherhood, Migos and Marshmello unite for a rap-rock collaboration and Chris Thile collects his tracks from A Prairie Home Companion into an album.

title: Kim Davis Denied Him a Marriage License. Hes Running to Replace Her.
description: In 2015, David Ermold wanted a marriage license, but was denied by his county clerk, Kim Davis. Now he wants her job.

title: The Next Flu Pandemic Will Appear When You Least Expect It
description: If a new flu pandemic emerges, it may be easy to spot. The epidemic is most likely to appear in spring or summer, researchers have found  not in the midwinter depths of the flu season.

title: Everything You Wanted to Know About Baseballs Intriguing Two-Way Player
description: Its official: Shohei Ohtani, the so-called Babe Ruth of Japan, will take up his new life in the United States as a member of the Los Angeles Angels.

title: Big Little Lies to Return for a Second Season
description: Big Little Lies is getting a little bigger.

title: Some Older Smokers Turn to Vaping. That May Not Be a Bad Idea.
description: Jeannie Cox currently enjoys a flavor called Coffee & Cream when she vapes. Shes also fond of White Lotus, which tastes kind of fruity.

title: The Fallout From Trumps Jerusalem Shift
description: What could go wrong in the aftermath of President Trumps decision to formally recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

title: Review: Brooklyn Nutcracker Is Simply, Imperfectly Charming
description: On Thursday, I went to The Brooklyn Nutcracker with a friend who grew up in Paris. A cosmopolitan balletomane, he can compare New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theater not only with each other but also with the Paris Opera Ballet and other top troupes. He enjoys disagreeing with me about the relative merits of Swan Lake productions. Before the show, he issued strong views on the sanctity of Tchaikovskys score.

title: This Judge Defends Unredeemables Even as He Sends Them to Prison
description: It seemed routine when Judge Jack B. Weinstein issued stiff prison sentences to three young men who had robbed a family at gunpoint in the Cypress Hills Houses in East New York last year. After all, when the men broke into the familys apartment, there were, in addition to adults, five children inside  all of them 10 years old or younger. The robbers, moreover, had been accused of working with two violent street gangs, which New York law-enforcement officers have been cracking down on  especially in the citys public housing projects.

title: Behind the Screams
description: See how we made our scariest-ever Great Performers issue.

title: A Rite of Passage for a Los Angeles Mayor: A Natural Disaster
description: LOS ANGELES  There were visits to two fire sites. Meetings with firefighters at command posts, and two news conferences 15 miles apart.

title: Fashion, Dinosaurs and Food
description: Galas were held last week for Lincoln Center, the American Museum of Natural History, and Food Allergy Research and Education.

title: U.S. Faces Blunt Criticism at U.N. Over Jerusalem Decree
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States faced blunt and sometimes withering criticism from friends and adversaries alike at the United Nations on Friday over President Trumps declaration that Jerusalem is Israels capital and his plans to move the American Embassy to the highly contested holy city.

title: Fixing the Housing Authority in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Tackling Gun Violence
description: To the Editor:

title: Wiki, Formerly of the Hip-Hop Collective Ratking, Strikes Out on His Own
description: Patrick Morales, a.k.a. Wiki

title: The CVS-Aetna Merger
description: To the Editor:

title: The Second Coming of the KKK
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: My Generation Thought Women Were Empowered. Did We Deceive Ourselves?
description: When I started out in journalism in the 1970s, attitudes toward sexual harassment among the token women sprinkled about in newsrooms were nearly antithetical to those weve heard from the women who have come forth in recent weeks with a flood of anguished revelations.

title: Trump and the Foreign Service
description: To the Editor:

title: Eluding Censors, a Magazine Covers Southeast Asias Literary Scene
description: HONG KONG  At Monument Books, a bookstore in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, the magazine racks are stacked with copies of The Economist and other titles from Britain, Australia, France and the United States.

title: Under New Tax Plan, the Cost of Aging Could Rise
description: In the coming days, a small group of Republicans will meet in Washington to try to settle a simple question: Should their revised tax bill eliminate a deduction for medical expenses and take away thousands of dollars each year from many people who are sick and, often, old?

title: Brazen Virtuosity: The Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments on YouTube
description: Our critics and reporters offer a glimpse of whats moved and delighted them on YouTube. Read the rest of our classical music coverage here.

title: Bobby Flays Recipe for Looking Tailored
description: The chef and restaurateur Bobby Flay, 52, often appears on television in his chef coat, but off screen hes found a reliable style thats part cozy, part tailored. It helps that he stays trim, too, which is no small feat for a chef who travels so much. His secret? Healthy cooking, of course, which is also the topic of this latest cookbook, Bobby Flay Fit: 200 Recipes for a Healthy Lifestyle. Here, Mr. Flay shares his recipe for fashion, including brunch sweaters, Filson bags and Brooklyn sneakers.

title: Justice Dept. Investigating Fetal Tissue Transfers by Planned Parenthood and Others
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department appears to be laying the groundwork for an investigation into the transfer of fetal tissue by abortion providers, including Planned Parenthood, picking up where several Republican-led inquiries in Congress had dropped off last year.

title: Moore Accuser Says She Wrote Part of Yearbook Inscription
description: GEORGIANA, Ala.  Four days before an Alabama Senate election with broad implications for American government, the narrow questions of whether Roy S. Moore wrote in a high school yearbook 40 years ago, and what it means for sexual misconduct allegations against him, once again took center stage on Friday.

title: Five Days of Smoke and Fire in Southern California
description: Six major fires are burning across Southern California. They began Monday and many are still raging.

title: Ron Meyer, Who Coached S.M.U. to a Football Title, Dies at 76
description: Ron Meyer, a college and professional football coach who guided Southern Methodist University to the 1981 Southwest Conference championship but left soon after while the team was on probation for recruiting violations, some of which he was accused of, died on Tuesday in Austin, Tex. He was 76.

title: How We Deal With Harassment Charges
description: To the Editor:

title: In Syrias Skies, Close Calls With Russian Warplanes
description: AL UDEID AIR BASE, Qatar  Russian fighter jets have flown dangerously close to American warplanes in eastern Syria over the past month  including one near-collision  in what American officials say is a pattern of daily Russian violations of an agreement to separate rival forces converging on the last main pocket of Islamic State militants in the country.

title: Songs, Music Publisher of Lorde and Diplo, Bought by Kobalt
description: In a closely watched music deal, one upstart is buying another for the rights to a catalog of fresh pop hits like Lordes Royals and the Weeknds Cant Feel My Face.

title: Why We Hear Some Silent GIFs
description: This week, in an improbable turn of events, the sound of silence went viral.

title: Dozens of Horses Killed as Fires Tear Through California
description: The fires sweeping through Southern California, destroying property and threatening human lives, have also killed at least 54 horses, according to the authorities.

title: F.B.I. Warned Hope Hicks About Emails From Russian Operatives
description: WASHINGTON  F.B.I. officials warned one of President Trumps top advisers, Hope Hicks, earlier this year about repeated attempts by Russian operatives to make contact with her during the presidential transition, according to people familiar with the events.

title: Supplements Claiming to Ease Opioid Addiction Come Under Scrutiny
description: Chris Beekman, whose company sells the dietary supplement Opiate Detox Pro, does not understand what all the fuss is about.

title: Mickey Gurdus, Who Eavesdropped on the World, Dies at 73
description: Mickey Gurdus was always a good listener.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: In 2017, Pop Music Made Triumph Out of Tough Times
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Who Is Hope Hicks?
description: Ms. Hicks, President Trumps 29-year-old communications director and one of his longest-serving advisers, has left the White House. Her departure leaves a void in Mr. Trumps inner circle.

title: For Female Lobbyists, Harassment Often Accompanies Access
description: Vanessa Alarid was a lobbyist in New Mexico when she asked a lawmaker over drinks one night if she could count on his support for a bill that appeared to be coming down to a single vote.

title: With Al Franken Coming Home, Minnesotans Watch and Reel
description: MINNEAPOLIS  When Bryan Dahlmeier, a 41-year-old manager of a body shop, first heard that Senator Al Franken was accused of groping a woman, he was willing to extend him some Minnesota Nice.

title: Report Into FIFA Raises Questions About Ethics Investigator
description: LISBON  The job of chief ethics investigator for the often ethically challenged FIFA has a tortured history.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Tower Planned for Upper West Side May Be Too Tall and Too Late
description: In a city seemingly exhausted by a long-running construction boom, the number of pitched battles over new developments appears to be growing.

title: Judge Voids Loans to Impaired Players in N.F.L. Concussion Case
description: A group of former pro football players with cognitive impairment who took out tens of thousands of dollars in high-interest loans against their expected payments in the N.F.L. concussion settlement may not have to pay their lenders back.

title: The Halifax Explosion and Au Revoir to Hi: The Canada Letter
description: While I was in Halifax this week to write about the massive explosion there 100 years ago that killed 2,000 people and injured 10,000, I went to a screening of a documentary film without a soundtrack. But I wouldnt call it a silent movie.

title: Clint Dempsey on His Heart, His Career and Another Chance at a Title
description: TORONTO  The tests had gone on for months, Clint Dempsey said, but the palpitations in his chest simply would not go away. They accompanied him to games and to practice, while he represented his club and then his country. Week after week, no one was able to tell him what was happening.

title: Apple Said to Be Acquiring Shazam, the Song Identifying App
description: A decade ago, Apples iPhone helped make a music-tech star out of Shazam, the app that, almost like magic, could identify a song just by hearing a few seconds of it.

title: Tillerson Criticizes Saudi Arabia, Citing Its Policies in Yemen and Lebanon
description: PARIS  The Trump administrations infatuation with Saudi Arabia  a defining element of President Trumps early foreign policy  is cooling.

title: Focus on Shareholders Holds Back U.S. Wage Growth
description: Corporate Americas shareholder-first ethos is holding back wage growth. The United States economy added a healthy 228,000 jobs in November, which was more than expected, but wage growth remained tepid. President Trump claims the Republican tax bill will lead to big raises, but most companies plan to spend any profit on buybacks and dividends.

title: Court Rules Against Brendan Dassey, Subject of Making a Murderer
description: The seesaw legal battle of Brendan Dassey, whose conviction was questioned in the Netflix documentary series Making a Murderer, took another turn on Friday as a federal court in Chicago ruled against him, dealing a major blow to his hopes of being freed from prison.

title: The Crown Season 2 Premiere: We Must Maintain the Status Quo
description: It must be hard, when youre the queen of England, to find a true friend among all the sycophants. But its a safe bet that anyone who will complain to your face about the food at Buckingham Palace isnt telling you only what you want to hear.

title: Wildfires, Puerto Rico, Star Wars: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: This Blog, R.I.P.
description: I was apparently the first blogger for The New York Times, most recently using this on the ground space for my own ruminations and those of others. But this technology platform is no longer going to be maintained, and weve decided that the world has moved on from blogs  so this is the last post here.

title: Justices to Hear Second Partisan Gerrymandering Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court added a second partisan gerrymandering case to its docket on Friday, suggesting that the justices are seriously considering whether voting maps warped by politics may sometimes cross a constitutional line. The court has never struck down a voting district as an unconstitutional partisan gerrymander.

title: Cuomo Administration Faces an F.B.I. Investigation Into Payroll Practices
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos hiring practices are under investigation, as F.B.I. agents and federal prosecutors have begun examining how staff members working in the governors office are being paid by other New York State authorities and agencies.

title: We Watched Our House Burn: Losing It All in Californias Fires
description: In Ventura County, Jack Selby watched his childhood home burn to the ground, and Nancy Cole lost all her possessions, including family heirlooms from Holocaust survivors.

title: CNN Corrects a Trump Story, Fueling Claims of Fake News
description: CNN on Friday corrected an erroneous report that Donald Trump Jr. had received advance notice from the anti-secrecy group WikiLeaks about a trove of hacked documents that it planned to release during last years presidential campaign.

title: James Levine Will Not Face Criminal Charges in Illinois
description: Law enforcement officials in Illinois said Friday that they would not bring criminal charges against the famed Metropolitan Opera conductor James Levine, noting that the man accusing Mr. Levine of sexual abuse there three decades ago had been 16 at the time  which was then the age of consent.

title: Snow in Texas Is Pretty Cool for Children Seeing It for the First Time
description: In his 10 years, Vincent Rivera of Corpus Christi, Tex., knew snow only as something experienced by others.

title: Tracy Stallard, Who Gave Up Historic Maris Homer, Dies at 80
description: Tracy Stallard, who became a footnote in baseball history for throwing the pitch that the Yankees Roger Maris hit for his 61st home run on the last day of the 1961 season  breaking one of the games most cherished records, Babe Ruths 60-homer season for the 1927 Yankees  died on Wednesday in Kingsport, Tenn. He was 80.

title: Leslie Wolfe, Who Pursued Equality for Women, Dies at 74
description: Leslie R. Wolfe, who pursued equality for women, particularly women of color, as a longtime leader of the Center for Women Policy Studies in Washington, died on Nov. 30 in Rockville, Md. She was 74.

title: Saudi Arabia Disputes That Crown Prince Bought Salvator Mundi
description: LONDON  The Saudi Embassy in Washington on Friday offered a new explanation for the record-breaking $450.3 million purchase last month of a painting by Leonardo da Vinci.

title: The Great Al Franken Moment
description: Ten years from now, do you think well be talking about where we were when Al Franken announced he was resigning from the Senate?

title: Justices, Divided 5-4, Let Trump Shield DACA Documents
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration may temporarily shield documents concerning its decision to end a program that protected some 800,000 young, undocumented immigrants from deportation, the Supreme Court ruled Friday in a brief, unsigned order. The court said it would consider the matter further, and it set an expedited briefing schedule.

title: Shohei Ohtanis Arrival Is a Departure for the Angels and Mike Trout
description: Even by his own high standards, Mike Trout is having a very good week. He and his fiance, Jessica Tara Cox, are getting married on Saturday. His beloved football team, the first-place Philadelphia Eagles, is training this week at his home ballpark in Anaheim, Calif. There are even unusual weather patterns whipping around the country and Trout, an amateur storm-tracker, must be fascinated.

title: Trent Franks, Accused of Offering $5 Million to Aide for Surrogacy, Resigns
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Trent Franks announced Friday that he would resign from Congress immediately after accusations emerged that he had offered $5 million to a female employee to be a surrogate mother for his children, and that she and another female employee worried that the lawmaker wanted to have sex as a means of impregnating them.

title: In Scorched California, a Year of Epic Firefighting Is Testing Limits
description: VENTURA, Calif.  Fresh off a 24-hour shift in fire-filled valleys, Fabian Uresti, a veteran firefighter from Californias Central Valley, shrugged off the question of whether he would make it home for Christmas.

title: Liberal Activists to Democrats: Protect Young Immigrants or Shut Down Government
description: WASHINGTON  Liberal activists, eager for Democrats to assert what power they have left in Congress, are pressing Democratic leaders to shut down the government this Christmas if Republicans do not agree to shield young undocumented immigrants from deportation.

title: Jerusalem Denial Complex
description: If nothing else, Donald Trumps decision on Wednesday to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital shows how disenthralled his administration is with traditional pieties about the Middle East. Its about time.

title: Dont Give Kids Holiday Gifts That Can Spy on Them
description: SAN FRANCISCO  During the holiday season, my husband and I tend to offer suggestions to those who are generous enough to insist on buying presents for our kids. Things like Dont spend more than $50 and No guns. Or, for those with whom we can be comfortably blunt, Just cash, please.

title: What Facebook Taught Me About Net Neutrality
description: My first glimpse of a world without strong protections for net neutrality was in 2004, when I was part of the team that created Facebook. Though its hard to imagine now, TheFacebook (as it was called at the time) was just a fledgling college social network, growing school by school. Some colleges didnt like Facebook, and because they functioned as their students internet providers, they would simply block the site.

title: Shohei Ohtani Could Be an Angel in the Outfield, and on the Mound
description: What could be a new era in baseball now appears ready for a tryout next year in Anaheim, Calif.

title: Trumps Scare Tactics on North Korea Scare Us
description: North Koreas launch last week of a type of missile that may soon be able to deliver a nuclear warhead to the United States mainland set off the Trump administration on a troubling new trajectory.

title: Lets Talk About Closing the Subway
description: Politicians often shun the suggestion that they should avoid clichs like the plague, and officeholders in New York are no exception. Some of them have leaned extra hard lately on one of their more shopworn banalities: how theirs is the city that never sleeps.

title: The Scoundrel Theory of American Politics
description: THERE have always been and always will be scoundrels in political life, especially one particular genus  the hypocrite  whose private behavior diverges from his public actions. But there is also a novel and ominous concept of the statesman emerging in American politics, most clearly in the gymnastic contortions being accomplished to justify support for the Senate campaign of Roy Moore, the former chief justice of Alabama: the politician as a disembodied policy array.

title: Mikheil Saakashvili, Ex-President of Georgia, Arrested in Ukraine, Again
description: MOSCOW  Mikheil Saakashvili, the former president of Georgia, was arrested on Friday in Ukraine during a late-night police raid on an apartment where he had been hiding after his escape from custody following a rooftop struggle with security agents this week.

title: Two Teams Are Out on Giancarlo Stanton; Could the Yankees Be In?
description: With 59 home runs and a National League Most Valuable Player Award last season, Giancarlo Stanton gave a precious gift to Derek Jeter, the new chief executive of the Miami Marlins. Stanton, in full bloom as baseballs pre-eminent slugger, would be a commodity on the trade market.

title: The Man Who Shot Vietnam
description: On Dec. 6, 1967, Horst Faas, the chief photographer of The Associated Press in Vietnam, was pinned down in a slim trench among the rubber trees lining the American air base at Bu Dop, just a few miles from the Cambodian border. It was less than two months before the launch of the Tet offensive and the area was teeming with Viet Cong activity.

title: Doom Season in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  Before the fires came, our skin turned dry and the winds cleared the smog from the air. November passed with barely any rain, and on Thanksgiving the high was 92 degrees. We Angelenos had been blessed with a beautiful autumn. But all the while, we felt a sense of doom.

title: Terrorist Groups Vow Bloodshed over Jerusalem Decision. ISIS? Less So.
description: Osama bin Laden was just 14 when his mother noticed that he had stopped watching his favorite Westerns. She found him fixated instead on news reports about Palestinians, tears streaming down his face as he watched TV in their home in Saudi Arabia.

title: Giggle
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  As Deb and her intrepid cruciverbal Argonauts embark, so I arise from the depths of the Atlantic, rubbing the salt from my eyes and brushing the mermaids purses out of my hair, for there can be but one of us at a time at sea, and only one ruling the land.

title: Bears Ears Is Here to Stay
description: This will always be Native land. But the protections President Trump is gutting are sorely needed.

title: Quotation of the Day: At Columbia, Three Women, 30 Years and a Pattern of Harassment
description: I played the game I learned in seventh grade when a boy likes you. You make up some reason so that you protect their feelings, so that they dont get angry with you, and you still manage to escape. Its a skill a 12-year-old girl learns that she needs for the rest of her life.

title: Corrections: December 9, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Selma and the Major League Soccer Cup
description: Ava DuVernays Selma airs on FXM. And the Seattle Sounders play the Toronto FC in the finale of the Major League Soccer Cup.

title: Explore Bears Ears Through Indigenous Voices
description: Bears Ears National Monument is at the center of Americas public lands debate. Visit the area in 360 and hear from some of the people affected by the boundary change.

title: The Oberoi Hotel in New Delhi Got a Major Makeover. Here Is a First Look.
description: New Delhis Oberoi hotel has a dear place in my heart, as it does for many city natives. On special occasions, including my sixth birthday, my parents and grandmother would take my sister and me to the propertys restaurant, the Caf, for afternoon tea and pastries  the flaky chocolate cake was a favorite. But my familys affiliation with the property predated me: my mother, Kiran, and my father, Vikesh, used to frequent the Oberois lobby in the early 1970s with their college friends; the hotel was the epicenter for Indias glitterati, and they were always on the lookout for a boldface sighting.

title: With Alabama Senate Race Defined by Scandal, Policy Issues Are Overlooked
description: HALEYVILLE, Ala.  The hospital here, the only one in the county, is planning to close this month.

title: 10 Hot Toys That Changed the Way People Play
description: The Fingerling Monkey may be this years hottest toy, but its popularity is far from unparalleled. A new must-have toy seems to arrive every holiday season. Richard Gottlieb, the chief executive of Global Toy Experts and publisher of Global Toy News, discussed some of the Fingerlings craze-making predecessors over the last generation.

title: How the Fingerling Caught On (Robot Grip and All) as 2017s Hot Toy
description: About two years ago, Sydney Wiseman had a challenging assignment for an engineer at her family toy company.

title: You Know, I Never Told You This
description: After millions of #MeToo tweets and an onslaught of media exposs of sexual misconduct accusations against public figures, some readers are broaching the topic of sexual assault with their families, revealing experiences they once felt too ashamed to discuss.

title: Welcome to Chinas Florida: Sun, Sand and Retired Snowbirds
description: SANYA, China  While the white-sand beaches and five-star international resorts are meant to be the main attraction, for the hundreds of thousands of Chinese retirees who descend upon this tropical city every winter, dancing on the seaside promenade is often the real draw.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Just Say It
description: Words can be wielded like weapons. On todays episode we hear from letter writers who have something to confess but are afraid to hurt others with the power of their words.

title: Hey, Budtender: Los Angeless Power Brokers of Pot Crank Up the Kook
description: LOS ANGELES  Carli Jo Bidlingmaier was talking to a group of 20-somethings in a living room in the Bel-Air neighborhood here, weeks before the wildfires. She was explaining that consuming marijuana allows a woman to awaken her yoni, a Sanskrit term for vagina favored by Hollywood bohemians.

title: Leave the Bucket Lists to Those Ambitious Boomers. Its Tee Time.
description: Before Art Lerner retired, he could not imagine how he would fill the days. He had few hobbies  come to think of it, only one: fishing. But at his firms urging, Mr. Lerner, a money manager, had already stayed on the job for three more years than he intended, and Id had enough, he said.

title: After-School Special
description: It really started around my fifth year in New York  both friends and strangers telling me that I needed to accept the harsh reality of becoming a New Yorker. This conversation was always awkward, less because of the premise and more the tone: It was consistently less congratulatory and more gotcha. But that made sense: New York City is the great collector of souls, eternally capable in the art of lengthening stays and erasing plans of ever leaving.

title: The Long Search to Ferret Out the Salvator Mundi Buyer
description: Perhaps the most challenging  often maddening  aspect of covering auctions is trying to figure out who bought what. Indeed, the competitive current coursing through the press corps at any auction is largely fueled by the desire to match the dealers or art advisers bidding in the room (or the auction specialists taking bids on the phone) with the buyers they represent.

title: Readers and The Times Respond to Harvey Weinsteins Page One Portrait
description: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.

title: Boris Johnson Presses Iran on Detained Britons
description: TEHRAN  Britains foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, expressed concern on Saturday in Tehran about British-Iranian citizens detained in Iran, a group that includes Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, whose trial and imprisonment has stirred tensions between the two nations.

title: 3 Homages to Nature
description: As President Trump prepares to shrink two national monuments in Utah, here are three books by writers who have presented passionate cases for the preservation of nature.

title: Janet Yellen Didnt Set Out to Be a Feminist Hero
description: She has been called a small lady with a large I.Q. She has been mocked for wearing the same outfit to both her official White House nomination and her confirmation hearing. (At least we know her mind wont be preoccupied with haute couture, a Washington gossip columnist wrote.) And when President Barack Obama once referred to Janet L. Yellen as Mr. Yellen, she didnt bother correcting him.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. Keep your PJs on a little longer. Put on some holiday music, sink into a comfortable chair and give yourself the gift of reading because we have some great stories for you!

title: For Older Venezuelans, Fleeing Crisis Means Starting From Zero, Even at 90
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Mara Abad Cruz, 90, sits on the cusp of her fourth migration, and it may be the hardest one.

title: Merci, Johnny: Hallyday Honored With Rock-Star Funeral (and Motorbikes)
description: PARIS  Hundreds of motorcycles roared down the Champs-lyses and crowds sang in unison as tens of thousands of fans of Johnny Hallyday, the French rock star who died this past week, lined the streets of Paris on Saturday for his funeral procession.

title: Can Marriott Keep Starwoods Culture of Cool, and Its Customers?
description: PITTSBURGH  Consider the conundrum of the modern hotel-room shopper.

title: A North Korean Defector Is Spurned, for Decades, by South Korea
description: ANSAN, South Korea  Few North Koreans have sought South Korean citizenship as long and as doggedly as Kim Seok-cheol.

title: The Rich and Royal History of Purple, the Color of 2018
description: We interrupt your daily newsfeed with this message brought to you by purple, which traveled all the way from ancient times to become the color of 2018.

title: Its Sluggers Inc., as Giancarlo Stanton Joins Aaron Judge on the Yankees
description: For two years, the Yankees moved deftly through an uncharacteristic rebuilding process, establishing a growing nucleus of inexpensive and talented young players that seemed to defy the teams long-established identity as one of the biggest spenders in baseball.

title: A Food Writer Gives His Bride Four Stars
description: Paola Briseo Gonzlez and Javier Cabral were married Dec. 9 at Villa Mandarinas in the resort town of Puerto Vallarta, in Jalisco, Mexico. Judge Noemi Palacios officiated. Earlier in the day, Rojelio Cabral, a brother of the groom, led a spiritual ceremony at the same place.

title: Can the Landlord Do Anything to Help Prevent Package Theft?
description: Q. Packages, including mine, have been taken from the mailroom of my rental apartment building in Hudson Heights. I filed a police report and alerted building management. Someone was arrested. But I am still concerned about security in our non-doorman building. For example, I saw a deliveryman using a credit card to pop open the lock to the entrance door to make a delivery. I have spoken with neighbors about circulating a petition demanding that the landlord improve security. But what are our rights? With the holidays coming, deliveries will only increase.

title: A Dentists Office Disguised as an Undersea Playground
description: We spoke with Joeamy Rios, a dental assistant at Adelberg Montalvan Pediatric Dental and Orthopedics in Nesconset, N.Y., about working in an office with an aquatic theme.

title: Ojai, Calif., Ringed by Flames, Is an Ash-Covered Shangri-La
description: OJAI, Calif.  Ernest Niglio traded Brooklyn 20 years ago for healthy, spiritual living in this laid-back, picturesque town.

title: Pessimism and Paralysis in the Aftermath of the Financial Crisis
description: The latest job report was very good, except for one thing: wage growth is still much lower than it was before the financial crisis. And this reminds me of a controversy that raged around four or five years ago, during what now seems like a golden age  an era when it seemed as if facts and reasoned debate might actually matter for policy.

title: He Wanted to Stay Sober. So He Surrounded Himself With Drinkers.
description: Each night, after closing time at the Manhattan restaurant where Michael McGarry works, his colleagues wind down with whiskey sours and pale ales. Mr. McGarry takes a different drink, usually an espresso or a sparkling water.

title: Where to Watch Centuries of British History Through the Screen
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.

title: Reza Zarrab Reveals a Plot to Kill Him, and Is Accused of Rape
description: Reza Zarrab, the star prosecution witness in the trial of a Turkish banker charged in a billion-dollar scheme to violate United States sanctions on Iran, was in his seventh day of testimony in Manhattan this past week when he revealed what he called a jailhouse attempt to kill him.

title: Inside Trumps Hour-by-Hour Battle for Self-Preservation
description: WASHINGTON  Around 5:30 each morning, President Trump wakes and tunes into the television in the White Houses master bedroom. He flips to CNN for news, moves to Fox & Friends for comfort and messaging ideas, and sometimes watches MSNBCs Morning Joe because, friends suspect, it fires him up for the day.

title: Iraq Prime Minister Declares Victory Over ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq declared victory over the Islamic State on Saturday, announcing the end of more than three years of battles to regain control over nearly one-third of the country that had been under the terrorist groups dominion.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I have a big soft spot in my heart for Ann Patchett, the author quoted in todays Cox and Rathvon acrostic. At one point in my life, I (along with a lot of other people, Im sure) recommended the Patron Saint of Liars to anyone and everyone I met.

title: How to Save Money on Your Prescription Drugs
description: If youre willing to do a little extra work, it is possible to lower your prescription bills.

title: Prescription Drugs May Cost More With Insurance Than Without It
description: This article was written through collaboration between The New York Times and ProPublica, the independent, nonprofit investigative journalism organization.

title: Tax Plans May Give Your Co-Worker a Better Deal Than You
description: In most places, a dollar is a dollar. But in the tax code envisioned by Republicans, the amount you make may be less important than how you make it.

title: U.S. Put 92 Somalis on a Deportation Flight, Then Brought Them Back
description: Ninety-two Somali citizens were flown out of the United States under orders of deportation on Thursday, but their plane never made it to Somalia. The flight landed in the West African country of Senegal and, facing logistical problems, was rerouted back to the United States.

title: Team to Lead City Ballet During Martins Sexual Harassment Probe
description: New York City Ballet has selected an interim leadership team pending an internal investigation into sexual harassment allegations against Peter Martins, its ballet master in chief, the company announced on Saturday.

title: Tommy John Would Love a Plaque to Accompany All of His Fame
description: If the call comes for Tommy John late on Sunday afternoon, he will be ready. He lives in Palm Springs, Calif., and can make it to Los Angeles International Airport in plenty of time for a midnight flight to baseballs winter meetings in Orlando, Fla. If he takes the flight, it will mean that he has finally made the Hall of Fame.

title: Street Outside Russian Embassy in Washington May Be Renamed for a Dissident
description: WASHINGTON  At a Washington city council meeting this past week, Zhanna Nemtsova held aloft a blue sign with Russian script in white. The words, she said, translated as Nemtsov Bridge. The sign itself was a copy of ones left on a stretch of sidewalk in Moscow where her father, the Russian democratic activist Boris Y. Nemtsov, was gunned down in 2015.

title: Moores Rebuke of His Accuser and Other Distortions in Alabamas Senate Race
description: WASHINGTON  At a Friday night rally, President Trump urged supporters to vote for Roy S. Moore, the Republican candidate in an Alabama Senate race who has been accused of sexual misconduct.

title: Jerusalem: Its Tense, Crowded and Can Feel Like a Jail
description: JERUSALEM  This is a tense city on a good day.

title: The Jerusalem Issue, Explained
description: Why is President Trumps announcement that the United States now considers Jerusalem to be Israels capital such a big deal? Why are some experts warning of violence or an end to the peace process? Whats the dispute over Jerusalem all about, anyway? Lets review.

title: Roadkill on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTON  Alan Simpson was appalled by the injustice of it all.

title: Palestinians Dashed Hopes for Jerusalem
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  My nephew Aziz, a bright young man who returned to Ramallah this summer after studying in London, called me on Thursday morning, the day after the decision by the United States to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

title: The Baker and the Empire
description: There are fine constitutional lawyers who can argue back and forth about the Masterpiece Cakeshop case the Supreme Court heard last week, which will determine whether a Christian baker can decline to make a same-sex couples wedding cake. The courts decision will either limit antidiscrimination law or limit First Amendment protections, so its not surprising that you can find deeply-footnoted legal arguments on both sides.

title: For Veterans, a Path to Healing Moral Injury
description: When you have a physical injury, go to the doctor. A psychological injury? Get thee to a psychiatrist. But what can be done if you suffer from a moral injury?

title: How Arctic Drilling, Stymied for Decades, Made Surprise Return in Tax Bill
description: WASHINGTON  As another fevered push to open the pristine Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to energy exploration collapsed on the Senate floor in December 2005, Ted Stevens, then the powerful and wily Republican senator from Alaska, declared it the saddest day of my life.

title: Macron Steps Into Middle East Role as U.S. Retreats
description: PARIS  A year ago, no one would have envisioned President Emmanuel Macron of France as the public face of Western diplomacy in the Middle East. But that is not the case anymore.

title: I Grew Up Around Korean Beauty Products. Americans, Youve Been Had.
description: I admit it: I use Korean snail slime face serum. Its purported to contain anti-aging properties. I have no opinion as to whether snails are particularly young-looking, but my experience is that their excretions do work on humans. That aside, as someone who grew up among Korean beauty products, I find the worlds sudden fascination with Korean skin care, and its now-famous 12-step regimen, to be comical.

title: An Abomination. A Monster. Thats Me?
description: It used to be that when someone called me an abomination, I was in the presence of a homophobe.

title: Why I Can No Longer Call Myself an Evangelical Republican
description: There are times in life when the institutional ground underneath you begins to crumble  and with it, longstanding attachments. Such is the case for me when it comes to the Republican Party and evangelicalism.

title: The Looting of Americas Public Lands
description: The protections put in place over the last half-century by both political parties to guarantee Americans clean air, clean water and bountiful open space have been coming apart at the seams since President Trump took office. The last few weeks have been particularly brutal for conservationists and, indeed, anyone who believes that big chunks of Americas public lands, however rich they may be in commercial resources, are best left in their natural state.

title: The Importance of Dumb Mistakes in College
description: It seemed like a good idea at the time.

title: Pruitt Moves to Curb E.P.A.s Power to Demand Pollution Tests
description: E.P.A. enforcement officials nationwide rely on provisions of the Clean Air and Clean Water Acts that enable them to order polluters to test their emissions for legal violations. Mr. Pruitt, after a request from the oil industry, has put new limits on that power.

title: Alabama, Despite History of Unruly Politics, Has Never Seen Anything Like This
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  I dont think you can compare this one with anything, said Bill Baxley, 76, whose first foray into Alabama state politics was as attorney general nearly five decades ago.

title: Trump, Rejecting Calls to Stay Away, Speaks at Civil Rights Museum
description: JACKSON, Miss.  President Trumps presence jolted the opening of a civil rights museum here on Saturday, generating boycotts from some leaders in the movement and small protests by activists as the states attempt to confront its racially violent past clashed with more recent divisions wrought by Mr. Trumps presidency.

title: The Baker, the Gay Couple and the Wedding Cake
description: To the Editor:

title: Office Secret Santa Guidelines for 2017
description: Dear Colleagues,

title: Roy Moores Alabama
description: ARLEY, Ala.  I recently drove the back roads from Birmingham for over two hours before I finally found a sign for Roy Moore, the Republican candidate for the United States Senate, outside the Arley Coffee Shop. A retired coal miner who frequents what the cashier called the liars table put it to me in the familiar Winston County way. The women, he said of Mr. Moores accusers, were lying to make him look like a sexual predator. Groping, he added, used to be all right anyway.

title: From 2017: Video Shows Daniel Shaver Pleading for His Life Before Being Shot by Officer
description: [For more about police violence and unrest, go here]

title: In Indonesia, Women Begin to Fight Epidemic of Street Harassment
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Tunggal Pawestri says shell never forget being groped on a public bus while traveling to her high school in Jakarta, the Indonesian capital, when she was 14.

title: Full-Body Cast
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Some people love the holidays, others get melancholy, some people do both. The end of the year leads to nostalgia, lists, a statistical increase in lists of statistics. For those of us wedged into the Northern Hemisphere, the days are ridiculously short, and unless your time is consumed by delivering toys or a gingerbread business, its pretty sweet to hunker down for the night, at 4:30 p.m., with a weekend puzzle to dissect that gives your brain a bit of a workout.

title: DNA Tattoos Are the Final Frontier of Love
description: It all began with a floating leg.

title: With 2020 Census Looming, Worries About Fairness and Accuracy
description: WASHINGTON  Census experts and public officials are expressing growing concerns that the bedrock mission of the 2020 census  an accurate and trustworthy head count of everyone in the United States  is imperiled, with worrisome implications.

title: Parents, How Did You Get That Hot Toy? Share Your Story.
description: The New York Times wants to know to what lengths you have gone to get your child a toy for the holidays.

title: Toronto F.C. Wins M.L.S. Cup, and a Little Redemption
description: TORONTO  Toronto F.C. barreled into this seasons M.L.S. Cup final as something of a juggernaut. With the most expensive roster in the league, Toronto amassed a league-record 69 points in the regular season and, a year after losing the championship game on its home field, stormed back to the final.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Making of the No. 1 Monkey
description: You know you can trust a toy company if its toys fart. It knows what kids want.

title: The Yankees Will Always Be the Yankees, to the Delight of Only Some
description: There are more teams in Major League Baseball than players who have hit 50 home runs in a season. Thirty teams, 29 sluggers. Only one team has had two players hit 50 in the same year: the 1961 Yankees, one of the most overpowering teams in the history of the sport.

title: Corrections: December 10, 2017
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Angels Unveil Shohei Ohtani, Who Exudes Promise and Prudence
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Coming from Japan, Shohei Ohtani did not know how long it would take to choose his new team, or whether that team would be in the American or National League, or where that team played, but he wanted to prepare himself for every possibility. As proof, he said, examine his wardrobe on Saturday, when he was unveiled by the Los Angeles Angels.

title: Jeanne LaFrance, Michael Ervolini
description: Jeanne Catherine LaFrance and Michael Albert Ervolini are to be married Dec. 10 at the Lenox Hotel in Boston. Richard W. Lewis, a friend of the couple, received authorization from the secretary of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts to solemnize the marriage.

title: Sulin Carling, Michael Hartman
description: Laura Sulin Carling and Michael Ross Hartman were married Dec. 9. The Rev. Dr. Paul J. Carling, an Episcopal priest and an uncle of the bride, officiated at the Metropolitan Building in Long Island City, Queens.

title: James ODonnell, Lui Caleon
description: James Patrick ODonnell and Dr. Lui Deleon Caleon were married Dec. 9. Diana Moran, a Universal Life minister, performed the ceremony at the Chapel of the Flowers in Las Vegas.

title: Cassandra Roggen, Michael Seidmon
description: Cassandra Nicole Roggen and Michael Harris Seidmon were married Dec. 9. Rabbi Ranon J. Teller officiated at the St. Regis Hotel in Houston.

title: Katherine Pollak, Gregory Lamp
description: Katherine Elizabeth Pollak and Gregory Mark Lamp were married Dec. 9 at 501 Union, an event space in Brooklyn. The Rev. Eleanor Harrison Bregman, a United Church of Christ minister, officiated.

title: Margaret Fisch, Joseph Baum
description: Margaret Fisch and Joseph Frank Baum are to be married Dec. 10 by Rabbi Peretz Chein at the Brooklyn Museum in Brooklyn.

title: Danielle Lang, Joseph Pileri
description: Danielle Marie Lang and Joseph Richard Pileri were married Dec. 9. Judge Richard A. Paez of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit officiated at the Richard H. Chambers Courthouse in Pasadena, Calif.

title: Mary Baskerville, Theodore Newman
description: Mary Elizabeth Baskerville and Theodore Ross Newman were married Dec. 9 at the Church of St. Monica in New York. The Rev. James R. Gould, who is a Roman Catholic priest and the brides godfather, led the ceremony with Rabbi David Schaefer participating.

title: Allison Keves, Jonathan Ellis
description: Allison Marie Keves and Jonathan Henry Ellis were married Dec. 9 at the Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers in Manhattan. Jamie Statter, a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Anna Ntiriwah Asare, Michael Tubbs
description: Anna Malaika Grace Ntiriwah Asare and Michael Derrick Tubbs were married Dec. 5. The Rev. Glenn R. Shields, a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at Progressive Community Church in Stockton, Calif., where he is the senior pastor. On Dec. 9, the couple had another ceremony with friends and family at the Iglesia de San Pedro Claver in Cartagena, Colombia.

title: Katherine Pantone, Kevin Rose
description: Katherine May Pantone and Kevin Edward Rose were married Dec. 9 at the Greenpoint Loft, an events space in Brooklyn. Timothy Kiely, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Marc Dickstein, Mark Dato
description: Marc Jason Dickstein and Mark Edward Dato were married Dec. 9 at the Liberty Warehouse, an event venue in Brooklyn. Rabbi Sonja K. Pilz officiated, with Matthew Green, a rabbinical student, participating.

title: Elizabeth Funes, Yin Perez
description: Elizabeth Funes and Yin Alexander Perez were married Dec. 8 at Villa Woodbine, an events space in Miami. Eddie Rodriguez, a minister of the Universal Brotherhood Movement, officiated.

title: Amanda Lebow, David Distenfeld
description: Amanda Marie Lebow and David Scott Distenfeld were married Dec. 9. Rabbi Michael R. Resnick officiated at the Breakers hotel in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The Walking Dead and Encore
description: Be prepared for a major death on The Walking Dead. And Kristen Bell tries to bring former musical theater stars back to their glory days in Encore.

title: S.N.L. and James Franco Tackle Al Franken and Sexual Harassment
description: There is no safe space in America where the countrys culture wars arent being waged  not even the make-believe workshop of a shopping mall Santa Claus  and no ears so innocent that they havent heard about the sexual misdeeds of some prominent men and accusations against others.

title: Vows: Keeping to a Tradition, Including Swords
description: Ashley Iorio and David Sands met at the United States Naval Academy and were wed on Veterans Day. Get glimpses from their wedding in 360 video.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1.5 Million
description: 11 Reid Avenue, Port Washington

title: Jerusalem, Wildfires, Roy Moore: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Protests in Lebanon Near U.S. Embassy After Trumps Jerusalem Decision
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Lebanese security forces on Sunday fired tear gas and water cannons into crowds that had gathered near the United States Embassy, in a sign that protests against President Trumps decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel may be escalating.

title: Birth Control and Breast Cancer: Putting the Risk in Perspective
description: I have a severe intestinal condition known as ulcerative colitis. For some time, Ive taken an immunosuppressant to control the flare-ups. Like all drugs, this one comes with side effects. While Im on it, I have an increased risk of developing myelosuppression, a condition in which my bone marrow might stop producing blood cells and platelets. I also have an increased risk of developing skin cancer.

title: Caring for a Son With Cancer, and for Herself
description: Andrew gave his mother, Regina Hensley, a reason to live. We follow the pair as she fights a history of addiction and he fights an aggressive form of cancer.

title: Without Andrew, I Cant Imagine What Life Would Be About.
description: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.

title: Max Clifford, Celebrity Publicist and Sex Offender, Dies After Collapsing in Prison
description: Max Clifford, once the highest-profile public relations agent in Britain, died on Sunday after collapsing in the prison in which he was serving an eight-year sentence for sexual offenses against victims as young as 15. He was 74.

title: Heritage Thermal Incident and E.P.A. Response
description: A case study of the slow progress being made by the Trump administration in wrapping up an investigation into an industrial accident in East Liverpool, Ohio, that generated protests from area residents.

title: Under Trump, E.P.A. Has Slowed Actions Against Polluters, and Put Limits on Enforcement Officers
description: EAST LIVERPOOL, Ohio  The highway billboard at the entrance to town still displays a giant campaign photograph of President Trump, who handily won the election across industrial Ohio. But a revolt is brewing here in East Liverpool over Mr. Trumps move to slow down the federal governments policing of air and water pollution.

title: How The Times Compared E.P.A. Enforcement Across Three Administrations
description: The analysis by The New York Times of the Trump administrations record in enforcing environmental regulations was based on data compiled by the Environmental Protection Agency and publicly available in its Enforcement and Compliance History Online database.

title: Gone With the Wind, a Puerto Rican Dream
description: There really ought to be a law about playing En Mi Viejo San Juan these days. Even in the best of times, the songs melancholy lyrics about a native son longing to return to Puerto Rico before dying is guaranteed to make listeners cry. This season  with tens of thousands forced to flee the island after the devastation of Hurricane Maria  the tear-jerker takes on a special meaning as a new generation of reluctant migrants is forced to find shelter with relatives in New York, Florida and elsewhere.

title: Review: Taylor Swift Leads a Jingle Ball Full of Hardheaded Women and Nice Guys
description: A seismic rumble. Lightning-flash strobes. A walloping kick-drum beat topped by a buzzing bass tone and hissing pink noise. Video screens pulsating in black, white and red. And at center stage of what looked like a Nine Inch Nails concert was Taylor Swift.

title: Pentagon Foresees at Least Two More Years of Combat in Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  Amid its escalating campaign of drone strikes in Somalia, the Pentagon has presented the White House with an operational plan that envisions at least two more years of combat against Islamist militants there, according to American officials familiar with internal deliberations.

title: They Lost Their Country. Then a Fire Robbed Them of Even More.
description: HALBA, Lebanon  In her three-room apartment here, Fatima al-Ewy yearned for her old life in Syria.

title: In a Blow to Hamas, Israel Destroys Tunnel From Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Israel said on Sunday that it had destroyed a tunnel dug by Hamas from Gaza into Israeli territory, dealing a substantial blow to one of the main strategic assets in the Islamic militant groups arsenal.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: Trump Wants Washington Post Reporter Fired Over Misleading Tweet
description: President Trump on Saturday called for a Washington Post reporter to be fired over a misleading tweet about the size of the crowd at a rally for the president on Friday in Pensacola, Fla.

title: Liberal Outsiders Pour Into Alabama Senate Race, Treading Lightly
description: SELMA, Ala.  In the poinsettia-trimmed pulpit of Ebenezer Missionary Baptist Church on Sunday morning, the Rev. James Perkins Jr., the first black mayor of a city where the right to vote was won in blood, announced his support for the Democrat Doug Jones in Alabamas special Senate election. He reminded his Selma congregants, without telling them how to vote, that sheep are to follow their shepherd.

title: Three Arrested After Firebomb Attack on Swedish Synagogue
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  The Swedish police arrested three people on Sunday after a masked gang hurled Molotov cocktails at a synagogue in the port city of Gothenburg as it hosted an event on Saturday night.

title: Why Experts Dont Believe This Is a Rare First Map of America
description: The map seemed to be an unbelievable find, an unknown fifth original of the rarest of documents, a vision of the world, circa 1507, by the famed German cartographer Martin Waldseemller. It features 12 so-called globe gores  like a world map drawn on an orange peel that has been sectioned and squashed flat.

title: Harassment All Around, Afghan Women Weigh Risks of Speaking Out
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Youre ugly, Maryam, everyone says so, but I guess youre a virgin so when youre ready to have sex, let me know and I will be glad to  Her male co-worker, writing on her Facebook account, finished the sentence obscenely.

title: Off-Duty Officer Is Robbed of His Gun in the Bronx, Police Say
description: An off-duty New York City police officer was hit over the head and robbed of his firearm early Sunday in the Bronx, the police said.

title: Boris Johnson Leaves Iran With Fate of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe Unclear
description: TEHRAN  Britains foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, left Tehran on Sunday without a clear public resolution on the fate of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the imprisoned British-Iranian dual citizen whose plight he had been accused of worsening.

title: Australia Diary: Claim Your Onions
description: Recently, I was on a morning peak hour train in Melbourne, and there was a tall, middle-aged woman sitting down on one of the disabled seats, with a young man in front of her standing up (they didnt know each other).

title: Review: In Today Is My Birthday, Love Is a Butt Dial
description: Like sadomasochists, playwrights sometimes seek freedom through peculiar restraints. Becketts experiments in deprivation  his monodrama Not I stars a pair of lips  explore how much can be removed from the theatrical experience and still leave theater. Other recent one-arm-tied challenges have included epistolary plays, plays performed in darkness and plays spoken in invented languages. Bess Wohls marvelous Small Mouth Sounds is set at a silent retreat.

title: No Longer at the Mayors Flank, Mark-Viverito Charts a New Path
description: When Melissa Mark-Viverito was elected as City Council speaker, some feared that her loyalty to Mayor Bill de Blasio would curtail her independence and influence.

title: Holdover Films Chug Away at the Box Office as Last Jedi Looms
description: LOS ANGELES  To paraphrase Gandalf by way of J.R.R. Tolkien, early December is the box offices deep breath before the plunge. New films are held back as Hollywood waits to capitalize on Christmas.

title: Louis C.K. Will Buy Back I Love You, Daddy
description: Louis C.K. will buy back the rights to his film I Love You, Daddy after sexual misconduct allegations led to the movies shelving.

title: Jerusalem, Bitcoin, Nobel Peace Prize: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: E.P.A. Slows Actions Against Polluters, and Put Limits on Enforcement Officers
description: An analysis of enforcement data at the E.P.A. shows a substantial drop in activity against polluters when compared to the Obama and Bush administrations.

title: As Brexit Looms, Paris Tries a Business Makeover
description: PARIS  The phone rings a lot at Paris Region Entreprises, a one-stop shop for companies deciding whether to move employees to the City of Light. Typically, callers ask about visas and minutiae of employment law. But not long ago, an executive from Japan called with a stumper: Where, he asked, are the dancing clubs?

title: Nikki Haley Says Women Who Accuse Trump of Misconduct Should Be Heard
description: WASHINGTON  Nikki R. Haley, the American ambassador to the United Nations, said on Sunday that women who have accused President Trump of sexual misconduct should be heard, a surprising break from the administrations longstanding assertion that the allegations are false and that voters rightly dismissed them when they elected Mr. Trump.

title: Nureyev Opens at Bolshoi After Delay and Much Speculation
description: MOSCOW  A country that does not value its heroes is such a shame. Thats a line spoken late in the Bolshoi Ballets Nureyev, the much anticipated, gossiped about, postponed and rescheduled new ballet about the great Russian dancer Rudolf Nureyev that opened at the Bolshoi Theater amid intense speculation and rumor here on Saturday.

title: VW Chief Breaks Ranks on Diesel, Suggesting End to Subsidies
description: The chief executive of Volkswagen said on Sunday that the German government should consider phasing out the subsidies that encourage Europeans to buy diesel cars, a startling change of position by the company largely responsible for diesels popularity in Europe.

title: After Fall of ISIS, Iraqs Second-Largest City Picks Up the Pieces
description: MOSUL, Iraq  In the heat of the late summer sun, weeks after the end of one of the largest urban battles since World War II, a high school principal trekked from his home in east Mosul to the west bank of the Tigris River to confront the ruins of his lifes work.

title: Heng on Chinese Influence in Australian Politics
description: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull of Australia revealed proposed laws to curb foreign influence in Australian politics, following reports of Chinese influence in Australian politics. The legislation is modeled on American laws that ban foreign campaign donations and require registration of foreign agents. The Chinese Embassy in Australia scolded Australian officials.

title: Paid Parental Leave in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: A Vast Federal Judiciary?
description: To the Editor:

title: Taxes and the Safety Net
description: To the Editor:

title: Privacy and Technology
description: To the Editor:

title: When Women Choose Sterilization
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Philip Glass, Easy to Mimic but Hard to Match
description: Is Philip Glass the creator of sprawling grand operas like Einstein on the Beach, or intimate, gloomy pieces like the Partita for Cello No. 2?

title: New Trailer: Ready Player One, From Steven Spielberg
description: Several times in Steven Spielbergs prolific career, hes released two films within a few months, like Jurassic Park in June 1993 and Schindlers List that December. Up to this point, the less weighty movie (War of the Worlds, The Adventures of Tintin) has always come out first, followed by a more serious Oscar contender (Munich, War Horse).

title: Three Points and Six Words: We Won Because We Were Better
