title: Weinstein: No. Pepsi: Yes. 2017 in Apologies.
description: From Harvey Weinstein to Pepsi to the National Park Service, 2017 has seen a lot of public apologies and non-apologies.

title: How Layers in a Latte Form
description: Any good barista will tell you that if you want to make a nice latte you pour milk into the espresso  not the other way around.

title: How the Tax Bill Hurts the Poorest Schools
description: Its common to hear people say that the quality of students education shouldnt depend on their ZIP code. But the Republican House and Senate tax bills would make ZIP codes matter more than ever. They would create an incentive to hoard opportunity by raising funds that remain close to home.

title: M. Butterfly Will Close This Sunday on Broadway
description: Two weeks ago, producers of the Broadway revival of M. Butterfly announced that the show would close six weeks early. But the show wont even make it to January  it will bow out this Sunday.

title: Safer Forms of Birth Control
description: To the Editor:

title: East Jerusalems History
description: To the Editor:

title: After the Times Square Bomb, Calls to Limit Immigration
description: To the Editor:

title: Turning the Lens Around on Richard Avedon
description: Faces, the photographer Richard Avedon once said, are the ledgers of our experience.

title: Indiegogo Goes Where Few Companies Dare: Into Initial Coin Offerings
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Indiegogo helped take crowdfunding mainstream. Now the company is hoping it can do the same for initial coin offerings, the popular but unregulated practice of selling custom virtual currencies to raise money for software projects.

title: Seven Films to Stream if You Loved The Shape of Water
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.

title: At an Alabama Rally, a Fathers Grief Over His Gay Daughter
description: Follow live results in the Alabama Senate race as they come in.

title: With Stanton Aboard, the Yankees Unload Chase Headley
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman was up until 1 a.m. Tuesday morning, texting with A.J. Preller, his counterpart with the San Diego Padres. The two were putting the finishing touches on a trade that, from the Yankees perspective, was really about making other moves.

title: Donald Trump Jr. Demands Leak Inquiry of House Intelligence Committee
description: WASHINGTON  Donald Trump Jr., the presidents eldest son, has asked the House Intelligence Committee to investigate information that was leaked from his closed interview with the committee last week.

title: Macron Holds a Climate Summit, and Trump Casts a Shadow
description: BOULOGNE-BILLANCOURT, France  Money was on everybodys mind at the climate summit meeting organized here on Tuesday, as President Emmanuel Macron of France tried to shore up support for the Paris climate deal by urging heads of state, chief executives and investors to commit more funding to the fight against global warming.

title: Victoria Azarenka Gets a Wild Card for the Australian Open
description: The Australian Open, which begins next month in Melbourne, will award a wild card to Victoria Azarenka, a former No. 1 player whose ranking has dropped to No. 210.

title: Ed Sheeran Raises Money for Liberia  and Is Promptly Shamed
description: Ed Sheeran may be the toast of Buckingham Palace, having received one of the countrys highest honors, the Order of the British Empire, for his services to music and charity. But last week he also received a dubious distinction: the star of the most offensive charity campaign of 2017. A charity watchdog group granted him its annual Rusty Radiator Award, accusing him and other celebrities of producing poverty porn.

title: The Political Power of Art
description: On a recent afternoon Ariel Foxman was having a one-way conversation with his son, Cielo, as he lifted up the newborn Lion King-style and then brought him in for a kiss. The baby, just 7 weeks old, was soon asleep on his shoulder.

title: When Judges Prey on Clerks
description: A few months after I graduated from Yale Law School in 2008, I started a clerkship for a judge on the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in Pasadena, Calif. Almost immediately, I heard rumors that Alex Kozinski, another judge whose chambers were in the same building, often made inappropriate sexual remarks to female clerks.

title: I Was Wrong About Bitcoin. Heres Why.
description: Several years ago, tech enthusiasts in San Francisco began buzzing about a new and mysterious thing called Bitcoin. There were rumors that the virtual money, invented by a pseudonymous math genius named Satoshi Nakamoto, would revolutionize modern finance and render government-backed currency obsolete. Or maybe it was just a passing fad.

title: Due Process and Sexual Harassment
description: To the Editor:

title: The Season of Womyn Is Coming to the Flea Theater
description: The Flea Theater, a nonprofit Off Off Broadway mainstay, is heading into the new year with three world premieres, fresh artists in residence, and new installments of its ongoing shows. On Tuesday, the TriBeCa theater announced that its winter and spring 2018 season, The Season of Womyn, will begin on Jan. 22 with the play Fill Fill Fill Fill Fill Fill Fill by Steph Del Rosso.

title: After Delay, City Council to Take Up Police Reform Bills
description: A pair of police reform measures vigorously opposed by New York Citys largest officers union is moving toward passage in the City Council, a last-ditch effort by its departing speaker, Melissa Mark-Viverito, who has staked her legacy on criminal justice reform.

title: The Popping of the Gun Bubble
description: Just before Thanksgiving, the families of nine victims and one survivor of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting came closer to something like justice than they had in the nearly five years since 20 children and six educators were murdered at the Connecticut school. They had their day before the states Supreme Court, which agreed to consider their contention that the maker of the AR-15 rifle used in the tragedy could be held liable for the killings.

title: 30 Years Later, Three Bands From New Yorks Downtown Scene Unite for One Night
description: Near the end of an hourlong set at the Kitchen on Saturday, the Jazz Passengers worked their way into Were All Jews, a playful and pungent original with a bawling melody. Saxophone, trombone and violin all tangled as the bass and vibraphone built a dicey polyrhythm underneath. The tunes melody almost name-checked the early years of Ornette Colemans Prime Time, but really it went past that. It reached back and grabbed onto Colemans own reference points: the chirruping bebop of Charlie Parker, Southern soul saxophone, the old Jewish prayer songs that he loved.

title: The Tunnel. Depressing, Claustrophobic and Now a Terror Target.
description: On a map, it is a vital artery for millions of commuters transferring from one subway line to another, a means of moving someone from deep in Queens to his job almost anywhere else in the city. But it is also, in person, just a tunnel, a particularly joyless and grim passageway even by New York City subway standards, wrapped by the sprawling Times Square station above and below. It is almost completely lacking in personality and identity; the police who patrol the station, when referring to the tunnel, call it the tunnel.

title: Fake News, Trumps Obsession, Is Now a Cudgel for Strongmen
description: BRUSSELS  President Trump routinely invokes the phrase fake news as a rhetorical tool to undermine opponents, rally his political base and try to discredit a mainstream American media that is aggressively investigating his presidency.

title: Bruce Brown, 80, Dies; His Endless Summer Documented Surfing
description: Bruce Brown, whose documentary The Endless Summer, which followed two surfers on an epic adventure in pursuit of the perfect wave, became an unlikely hit when it was released nationally in 1966, died on Sunday in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 80.

title: Bicycling the Blood Road
description: The Ho Chi Minh Trail was called the Blood Road because so many people lost their lives there. My father, Stephen Rusch, was one of them. He was the weapons system officer in an F-4 Phantom fighter jet. On March 7, 1972, he was flying a strike mission over Laos to bomb trucks spotted along the trail. His plane was struck by ground fire and crashed to the jungle floor. He didnt make it home.

title: Bryn Terfel Joins Cast Exodus From Met Operas New Tosca
description: The high-profile new production the Metropolitan Opera is planning to open on New Years Eve is Puccinis Tosca. But it is starting to resemble Agatha Christies trickle of killings And Then There Were None.

title: Silver Alert
description: Dear Diary:

title: Doug Jones, Kirsten Gillibrand, Star Wars: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Exxon Climate U-turn: Investors Should Do Their Homework
description: Exxon Mobils climate-change U-turn deserves some wary investor cheers. The $350 billion oil firm is finally planning to comply with shareholder demands  approved more than six months ago  to disclose how global warming will affect its business. Thats to be welcomed. But Exxons reputation regarding such concerns means investors need to not just trust, but verify.

title: Enrico Castellani, Artist in the Postwar Avant-Garde, Dies at 87
description: Enrico Castellani, an Italian artist who was a prominent member of Europes postwar avant-garde, died on Dec. 1 at his home in Celleno, Italy, near Rome. He was 87.

title: Roy Moore Drowns Us Out
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  At every home game at the University of Alabama, where I am a sophomore, the fraternities sit in a reserved corner of the stadium. My freshman year, they wore Trump stickers. This year, they traded them in for Roy Moore-style white cowboy hats.

title: Tillerson Says Embassy in Jerusalem Is at Least Three Years Away
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson said Tuesday that it is unlikely that the American Embassy will be moved to Jerusalem before 2020.

title: Macon Brock Jr., Co-Founder of Dollar Tree, Dies at 75
description: When Macon F. Brock Jr. and his partners pitched their idea to open a chain of dollar stores to developers at a shopping mall convention in the mid-1980s, they got a cold reception.

title: Los Angeles Fire Started in Homeless Encampment, Officials Say
description: LOS ANGELES  The fire that burned through one of the wealthiest neighborhoods in the country last week started as a cooking fire at a homeless encampment, according to an investigation by the Los Angeles Fire Department.

title: Tiny Moon May Orbit Distant Object That NASAs New Horizons Probe Will Visit
description: In just over a year, a NASA spacecraft will visit a tiny world at the edge of the solar system. Now that tiny object appears to have an even tinier moon, scientists announced on Tuesday.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Subway Tunnel Will Be Closed Entirely in Week After Christmas
description: During the effort to aggressively resuscitate New York Citys subway system, riders have encountered cars with seats removed to create extra room, new arrival countdown clocks and more frank announcements about delays, all aimed at reversing a steep decline in reliability.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through Dec. 18. SculptureCenter, 44-19 Purves Street, Queens; 718-361-1750, sculpture-center.org.

title: Quakes and Fires? Its the Cost of Living That Californians Cant Stomach
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Russel Lee and his wife spent the past few years going online to do the depressing math of how much less housing costs pretty much everywhere that isnt California. They looked at Idaho, Arizona, North Carolina and Kentucky, but Mr. Lee, who was born in San Francisco and has lived in the Bay Area his entire life, could never quite make the move. Then the fires came.

title: Republican Assemblyman Enters Race to Challenge Governor Cuomo
description: ALBANY  Brian M. Kolb is not a power broker or a kingmaker, a rabble-rouser or a political bomb thrower. Perhaps his main claim to fame is his durability: Mr. Kolb has served 17 years in the State Assembly, about half that time as the leader for the influence-free Republican minority, acting as an articulate, if toothless, foil to the overwhelming Democratic majority.

title: My Favorite Holiday Movie Involves a Giant Rabbit
description: In my favorite Christmas movie, Jimmy Stewart says, Well, Ive wrestled with reality for 35 years, doctor, and Im happy to state I finally won out over it.

title: Lighting Hanukkah Candles Under the Swastikas Shadow
description: Tonight, and for the next seven nights, millions of Jews around the world will light a menorah to celebrate Hanukkah. Akiva Mansbach will be one of them. But his isnt just any menorah. In its multigenerational life, its light has also touched the darkness.

title: A New Leader for Central Park
description: Elizabeth W. Smith grew up in Rye, N.Y., about an hour north of Manhattan, and said her earliest memory of Central Park was from when she moved to the Upper East Side after college. She would go running around the park  not in the park itself, but on the sidewalks just outside the stone walls that surround it.

title: Inside the New York Subway Tunnel Bombed By a Terror Suspect
description: One day after a would-be suicide attacker set off a bomb in a New York City subway tunnel, locals were already back to using it. Here's a look inside.

title: Terror Suspects Become Ammunition in War Over Immigration
description: The two terrorist attacks six weeks apart in New York City carried out by two recent immigrants were swiftly contained and the suspects arrested. But the political consequences instantly started reverberating.

title: From Revisionist History
description: The season-2 episode Ms. Buchanans Period of Adjustment looks at a deleterious bit of fallout from Brown v. Board of Education: The decisions effect on black teachers.

title: From Uncivil
description: In the episode The Deed, the journalists Chenjerai Kumanyika and Jack Hitt tell the story of the governments broken promise of 40 acres and a mule to former slaves by tying it to a modern land battle.

title: From Slow Burn
description: In the first episode, Martha, Slate reporter Leon Neyfakh revisits the saga of Martha Mitchell, a larger-than-life Watergate-adjacent loudmouth.

title: Jahlil Okafor Gets a Second Chance, and Nets Get a Bargain
description: At the threshold of his 22nd birthday, Jahlil Okafor is already considered to be a reclamation project, a redemptive giant. Its an incongruity he isnt debating or ducking.

title: City Agrees to Pay Rikers Inmates It Forced Back Into Solitary Confinement
description: For years, it was a rule in New York Citys jail system: If an inmate at Rikers Island who had been serving a stretch in solitary confinement before release returned to the jail, the person would be forced back into solitary no matter how much time had passed.

title: From The Thread
description: In the episode The Death of John Lennon, host Sean Braswell draws loose historical associations that link Lennons assassination back to Vladimir Lenin.

title: For Bombing Suspect, a Life Split Between Bangladesh and Brooklyn
description: A man with his feet on two continents, Akayed Ullah lived a life divided between Bangladesh and Brooklyn.

title: Disneys Deal for 21st Century Fox Is Said to Be Close
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company was poised to complete a once-unthinkable deal to swallow most of Rupert Murdochs movie and television empire, a $60 billion-plus acquisition that would supercharge Disneys global streaming-service ambitions, threaten to undercut Silicon Valleys entertainment aspirations and most likely prompt further consolidation in Hollywood.

title: Toasting Daniel Day-Lewis and His Potential Last Film
description: Sienna Miller, Michael Shannon, Jenna Lyons and more gathered at an Upper East Side townhouse to celebrate the New York premiere of Phantom Thread.

title: Daniel Day-Lewis Makes an Appearance at His Own Film Party
description: On Monday night, hours after Daniel Day-Lewis received his eighth Golden Globe nomination, he arrived at the stately Harold Pratt House on Park Avenue to toast the New York premiere of the movie that had earned him the nod, Phantom Thread, in which he portrays the renowned British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock.

title: Why the Getty Centers Art Stayed Put as Fires Raged Nearby
description: How the Getty Center protects its art from wildfires.

title: Who Says the Mets Dont Have a Plan? Its Called Mickey Callaway
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  The Mets most important addition this off-season might be a 42-year-old right-hander with a 4-11 career record and a 6.27 earned run average. He does have a .667 batting average, but has no hits in this century and has not thrown a pitch in the majors since 2004.

title: Fox News v. Robert Mueller
description: If only we could dismiss Sean Hannity, Jeanine Pirro, Laura Ingraham and the other well-paid propagandists at Fox News as though they were harmless drunks at the end of the bar, ticking off their conspiracy theories to anyone who will listen. Unfortunately, the guy sitting on the next stool is the president of the United States, and hes all ears.

title: Swedens Prime Minister Condemns Anti-Semitism in His Country
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  Prime Minister Stefan Lofven of Sweden told reporters in Paris on Tuesday that his country had a problem with anti-Semitism, the Swedish newspaper Svenska Dagbladet reported.

title: Who Bought That $450 Million Leonardo After All?
description: The big news in the art world the other day  and it was big  was the disclosure that Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the young Saudi heir whos detained dozens of cousins and tycoons in an anti-corruption drive, was the mysterious buyer who paid a fortune for a distinctly non-Islamic Leonardo at an auction at Christies in New York City last month. The man who placed the bid on the crown princes behalf was a little-known cousin with a lot less money but a much longer name, Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan al-Saud. There were companion reports that the painting would ultimately wind up in a museum in Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates capital and the new challenger for culture bragging rights on the Persian Gulf.

title: Review: In The Children, the Waters Rise and a Reckoning Comes Due
description: First the earthquake. Then the tsunami. Then the nuclear reactor shuts down when the tidal wave reaches its seaside dome. But not to worry. Thats why they have emergency generators.

title: Artist Flees Beijing After Filming Devastation of Mass Evictions
description: HONG KONG  When Hua Yong, a painter in Beijing, first witnessed the eviction of hundreds of thousands of migrant workers from the Chinese capital last month, he worried no one would believe the scope of it.

title: Wooers
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Is the photo at the top of this column alluring to you? Its Sugarloaf beach in Guadeloupe, one of the French West Indies (or Antilles), and it very narrowly escaped annihilation by Hurricane Irma. Doesnt it feel like if you spun a globe and blindly set your finger down, if you didnt find yourself in the middle of the sea you would probably hit a spot where some natural cataclysm had just happened (or was in the process of devastation now)? Beauty is fleeting and fragile, and it can lift or break your heart, cant it!

title: Quotation of the Day: No Embassy Move Soon, Tillerson Says
description: I didnt know anything about your culture, didnt know what motivates you, didnt know anything about your work, didnt know anything about how you get your work done.

title: In Texts, F.B.I. Officials in Russia Inquiry Said Clinton Just Has to Win
description: WASHINGTON  Senior F.B.I. officials who helped investigate Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign last year wrote in text messages that Hillary Clinton just has to win and described a potential Trump victory as terrifying, according to texts released Tuesday night.

title: Once a Long Shot, Democrat Doug Jones Wins Alabama Senate Race
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  Doug Jones, a Democratic former prosecutor who mounted a seemingly quixotic Senate campaign in the face of Republican dominance here, defeated his scandal-scarred opponent, Roy S. Moore, after a brutal campaign marked by accusations of sexual abuse and child molestation against the Republican.

title: Doug Jones: A Lawyer in the Thick of Alabamas Big Moments
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  The fact that Alabamas voters have sent a Democrat to the Senate for the first time since Howell Heflin retired in 1997 is a stunner, exceeded in incredibility only by the events that led to it  not least, that the Republican candidate, Roy S. Moore, saw his already prodigious history of controversy grow during the campaign to include allegations that he had molested teenagers.

title: Porzingis and Knicks Upstage Lonzo Balls Traveling Circus
description: Luke Walton has experience dealing with stars under a microscope. As an assistant coach for Golden State, he was on staff during the Warriors 2014-15 championship season and the following year, when they won 73 games. He played alongside Kobe Bryant and Shaquille ONeal as they wrestled for control of the Lakers during the early part of his playing career.

title: Thank Heaven for . . . Alabama?
description: Good riddance to Roy Moore and the horse he rode in on.

title: Roy Moore Loses, Sanity Reigns
description: That Alabamas voters chose Doug Jones for the United States Senate is cause for celebration. A triumph for decency and common sense in a state that seemed for a time at risk of abandoning both, Mr. Joness win narrows the Republicans Senate majority and delivers a deeply deserved rebuke to President Trump. It is hard to get too intoxicated by a slim victory over an atrocious candidate, a suspected sexual abuser with bigoted politics, but Alabama, the Senate and the nation will be a whole lot better off with Mr. Jones than with Roy Moore.

title: Video and Full Transcript: Doug Jones Speaks After Winning Alabama Senate Race
description: Doug Jones, a Democrat, beat Roy S. Moore, a controversial Republican who had been accused of sexual misconduct, in a special election for the Alabama Senate seat vacated by Jeff Sessions when he became attorney general, according to The Associated Press.

title: Belgiums Lavish Energy Use Sheds Light on More Than Just Its Roads
description: BRUSSELS  When an astronaut took nighttime pictures of Europe from the International Space Station this year, one nation stood out far below on the twinkling surface of the earth: Belgium.

title: He Was a Snob About Musicals. Then He Tried Out to Play Hamilton.
description: LONDON  Jamael Westman was 14 when he took the stage in his first musical, a school spoof of Pirates of the Caribbean called Pirates of the Curriculum. After that, he gave musical theater a nice long rest.

title: This Premier League Players Position? Left Out
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England  Stuart Taylor cherishes those few moments before the game starts. Almost two decades since his professional debut, the sense of occasion still strikes him as special: the vibrant green of the field, the sight of the stadium starting to fill, the sound gathering, the anticipation mounting.

title: Number of Jailed Journalists Hits Record High, Advocacy Group Says
description: The number of journalists jailed around the world in connection with their work has reached a record high of 262, according to a new report, with just over half of them imprisoned in Turkey, China or Egypt.

title: The Heroes of Burial Road
description: In Haitis capital, death is often harder to afford than life. The men who tend to the bodies told their stories to New York Times journalists.

title: Corrections: December 13, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Politicians Weigh In as Doug Jones Wins Alabama Senate Seat
description: For more than two hours on Tuesday night, many Americans bit their nails and glued themselves to a screen as the votes rolled in.

title: Alabama Says No to Trumps Tribalism
description: There are so many things I could say right now after watching Doug Jones defeat Roy Moore in the Senate race in Alabama, but for me it comes down to just two words: Thank you.

title: Alabama, Emmanuel Macron, Austria: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Video and Full Transcript: Roy Moore, Refusing to Concede, Addresses Supporters on Election Night
description: Roy S. Moore, the Republican Senate candidate in the Alabama special election, addressed his supporters on Tuesday night after The Associated Press called the race for his Democratic opponent, Doug Jones.

title: For Trump, a Moment of Defeat but Maybe Not Recalibration
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump does not readily admit defeat. Knocked to the mat in Alabama with the stunning loss of a Senate seat, he got right back up on Wednesday and defiantly claimed that he had known his candidate would lose all along. He may have been humbled by voters, but Mr. Trump does not exactly do humble.

title: As Goes Moore, So Goes Trumpism
description: In one of the strange rhymes that history favors, nearly eight years after Barack Obamas Democrats managed the extraordinary feat of losing a senate race in Massachusetts, Donald Trumps Republicans have matched the feat by losing a senate seat in Alabama. Roy Moore and Martha Coakley dont really have a lot in common personally, but their respective defeats have one essential similarity. They are both stark repudiations of a first-term president, foreshadowing a larger repudiation soon to come.

title: Trump and Bannon Cant Save the Day
description: Mobile, Ala.  Donald Trump and Steve Bannon are politically impotent.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Golden Globes History and The Fake News
description: Look back on footage from 75 years of the Golden Globes. And Ed Helms hosts a fake news show.

title: Toshiba Settles Fight With Western Digital That Imperiled a Major Deal
description: TOKYO  Toshiba has cleared one of the last remaining hurdles to a planned sale of its microchip subsidiary and moved a step away from the financial brink.

title: Pedophile Barred From Leaving Australia as Sex Tourism Law Takes Effect
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  An Australian law barring registered child sex offenders from international travel had an immediate impact when it took effect on Wednesday, stopping a convicted pedophile and turning him away from Sydney Airport.

title: Word + Quiz: anthropoid
4 Takeaways From Doug Joness Alabama Victory
description: WASHINGTON  Doug Joness defeat of Roy S. Moore in Tuesdays bitterly fought special Senate election was one of the most unlikely upsets in recent campaign history. But the Democrats victory in Alabama carries some more immediate political implications.

title: Robots
description: What story could this image tell?

title: New Selections for National Film Registry Include Superman, Titanic and Spartacus
description: Superman will fly forever, Titanic will never be sunk, Memento wont be forgotten and The Goonies will never say die: these are just some of the motion pictures that the Library of Congress has chosen for preservation in its National Film Registry.

title: Life in Puerto Rico Months After Hurricane Maria
description: Looking at the effects of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, through the eyes of six photographers who live or work on the island.

title: Philippines Extends Martial Law in South for Another Year
description: MANILA  The Philippine Congress on Wednesday approved a request from President Rodrigo Duterte to extend martial law on the southern island of Mindanao for another year, which the president said was needed to fight armed groups there.

title: When a Hurricane Hits Home: Life in Puerto Rico After Maria
description: Rather than risk being stranded in the countryside, Dennis Manuel Rivera rode out Hurricane Maria inside the newsroom of El Nuevo Da, Puerto Ricos leading newspaper. Once the winds passed, he headed to the airport, going from hangar to hangar looking for a pilot willing to fly over the island. They waited a day to fly over remote towns that had been cut off by broken bridges, uprooted trees and electrical cables.

title: Pete Souza Didnt Miss a Thing
description: You took nearly two million photos of Barack Obama as his chief official White House photographer. Everyone knows the situation-room photo, everyone knows Hair Like Mine. Can you tell in the moment when a picture is going to go viral? Most of the time youre sort of aware that youve captured a really important moment. The day of the bin Laden raid, I think I shot like a thousand photos. The one of the little kid touching his head, it just happened so fast I didnt realize the significance of the photo until I actually saw it at the end of the day.

title: How to Be a Better Traveler: Tips From 2017
description: This year, we covered a variety of topics to help you save time, money and your sanity while traveling. Here is a selection of those articles, with some tips and techniques gleaned from them. Share your ideas in the comments section.

title: What Were the Best and Worst Things About 2017 for You?
description: As December winds down and 2017 retrospectives begin to roll out, we thought we would ask you for your own lists.

title: Destroyed in Tsunami, a Temple Is Reborn
description: Join residents of a Japanese village devastated by the 2011 tsunami as they celebrate the rebuilding of the 1,000-year-old Buddhist Kongoji Temple on higher ground.

title: The Race to Erase Kevin Spacey
description: LOS ANGELES  The sun was setting on Nov. 7, when Christopher Plummer arrived at the Four Seasons Hotel in Manhattan for a secret, hastily arranged meeting.

title: Justice Dept. Official Defends Mueller as Republicans Try to Discredit Him
description: WASHINGTON  Deputy Attorney General Rod J. Rosenstein adamantly defended the character and impartiality of Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, as he came head-to-head on Wednesday with an increasingly aggressive campaign by Republicans to discredit the inquiry.

title: How 2017 Became a Turning Point for Tech Giants
description: This was a terrible year for the tech industry.

title: Rising Coal Exports Give Short-Term Aid to an Ailing Industry
description: A shake-up in global coal trading has delivered some oxygen to the struggling American mining industry, driving up exports to energy-hungry countries. But the relief may not last.

title: Propane, Peapods and Perplexities
description: VACATIONLANDTrue Stories From Painful BeachesBy John Hodgman257 pp. Viking. $25.

title: In Pittsburgh, the Airport Is a Destination
description: The idea of spending extra time at the airport might not appeal to most people, but for years the Pittsburgh community has been longing for just that. Pittsburgh International obliged, becoming the first airport in the United States since Sept. 11 to regularly allow non-passengers into secured areas.

title: Underneath Romain Garys Many Masks
description: PROMISE AT DAWN A Memoir By Romain Gary Translated by John Markham Beach 337 pp. New Directions. Paper, $16.95.

title: Can I Talk to My Dad About His Affair?
description: My mother recently let slip that my father had an affair several years ago. Im the oldest sibling in a family that I have always considered extremely close. The news was a devastating shock. Immediately after her disclosure, my mother told me that I could never tell my father that I knew. She insisted that the counseling they went through afterward resulted in a much happier marriage. Apparently, they decided to keep it a secret; only one other sibling knows.

title: Fed Predicts Modest Economic Growth From Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, buoyed by a steadily strengthening economy, raised interest rates on Wednesday for a fifth time since the financial crisis and predicted that a proposed tax cut moving through Congress would modestly increase economic growth for the next few years without stoking inflation.

title: I Wanted to Backcountry Ski in Vermont. So I Helped Clear the Trails.
description: On a crisp Vermont morning in early November I met up with about 50 other enthusiastic skiers and snowboarders who were ready for the coming winter season. There was no snow, so skiing was out of the picture and it would have complicated our objective anyway. We were there to help clean up areas of Brandon Gap, a mountainous area in the central Green Mountain National Forest, notable for its designation by the United States Forest Service for backcountry skiing.

title: An Opera Star Walks Into a Karaoke Bar
description: The bar hushed as one of the most dangerous songs to be found on any karaoke machine began to play: Queens Bohemian Rhapsody. Its Freddie Mercury high notes and falsetto rock choruses once led Buzzfeed to warn: Do not attempt without alcohol.

title: Christmas Around the World: 10 International Destinations to Visit
description: Cities all over the world celebrate Christmas in unique and memorable ways. Many showcase their historic, old-world beauty, while others impress with more modern traditions. The following 10 international destinations are just a few of the countless options to consider.

title: Roy Moores Horse Ride Draws Late-Night Ridicule
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: When Climate Change Becomes a Credit Problem
description: Climate change is now a credit issue for city and state governments vulnerable to extreme weather events and natural disasters made worse by global warming. And that will make a complicated problem a lot easier for people to understand, because it could hit them where they feel it: in their wallets.

title: Exercise May Aid Parkinsons Disease, but Make It Intense
description: Intense treadmill exercise can be safe for people who have recently been given diagnoses of Parkinsons disease and may substantially slow the progression of their condition, according to an important new study of adults in the early stages of the disease.

title: New York Today: Can the City Prevent Terror Attacks?
description: Good morning on this frigid Wednesday.

title: Newtown Is Still So Raw, 5 Years After Sandy Hook Shooting
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  Tangible reminders of the massacre still linger. On the door of the Blue Colony Diner, next to the quarter candy dispensers, a frayed sticker clings to the glass. A teddy bear with wings cradles a smaller bear, alongside a message declaring that the towns 26 Angels are Always Here, Never Forgotten.

title: Listen to The Daily: Democrat Wins Pivotal Alabama Senate Seat
description: The upset victory of Doug Jones in Alabama cuts the Republican majority in the Senate to just one seat.

title: Baby Born With Heart Outside Her Body Is Saved by U.K. Surgeons

description: The Tech Tip online column is published five days a week on The New York Timess Personal Technology page, which adds up to about 240 questions tackled over the course of a year on a variety of topics: hardware, software, social media, gadgets and more. Looking back on 2017, here are five Tips that stood out  either in their timeliness in syncing up with current events or in your positive response.

description: Daniel Ulbricht, a principal dancer with New York City Ballet, will organize a centennial tribute to Jerome Robbins as part of the coming season at Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival, which will run from June 20 through Aug. 26 in Becket, Mass., the festival announced on Wednesday.

description: NAPLES  Above the throng shoving its way along Via dei Tribunali, this pizza-crazed citys historic pizza thoroughfare, Antonio Borrelli leaned over the fake lemons hanging from the Balcony of Song above Antica Pizzeria Gino Sorbillo and dared sing something else.

title: Moving Notes in Google Keep to Other Programs
description: Q. I have a bunch of notes in the Google Keep app on my Android tablet, but Id like to move them into a word-processing program. Is there a way to do this from the tablet besides cutting and pasting the content into an email message and then into a document on my computer?

description: Omarosa Manigault Newman, who achieved a measure of fame playing a villain on The Apprentice and cemented a relationship with President Trump that led to a White House appointment, will be leaving her position in January, the administration said on Wednesday.

description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Cade Metz, a technology reporter for The Times based in San Francisco, discussed the tech he is using.

title: Rwanda Accuses France of Complicity in 1994 Genocide
description: KIGALI, Rwanda  The Rwandan government released an independent report on Wednesday accusing French officials of complicity in the 1994 genocide, risking further strains to already icy relations between the two countries.

title: Facebook Sees Little Evidence of Russian Meddling in Brexit Vote
description: LONDON  Facebook, confounding expectations, said on Wednesday that the company had found no evidence of a significant Russian effort to interfere in the British referendum last year on leaving the European Union.

title: Where Out-of-Town Girls Could Come Feel Safe in New York
description: At a recent event for the very active alumnae of Finch College, the genteel Upper East Side womens school that dramatically closed its doors in 1975, wine flowed along with conversation inside the music room of the Birch Wathen Lenox School on East 77th Street.

title: In Harlem, a Shelter That Gives Young Men the Tools to Succeed
description: Nestled on a residential block in Harlem, Create Young Adult Residences looks like any other apartment building. A fire escape snakes up its rust-colored facade.

title: The Big Sick and Get Out Land SAG Awards Nominations
description: The Screen Actors Guild Awards nominations threw a curveball into the awards race on Wednesday morning, shutting out early favorites The Post and The Shape of Water from its all-important list of outstanding cast nominees, and instead including The Big Sick  which was left out of Golden Globe nominations earlier this week  and Get Out.

title: For McConnell, Alabama Senate Loss Is Bad News and Good News
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, was not in a talking mood on Wednesday as he sped through the corridors of the Capitol. It had been roughly 12 hours since Doug Jones, a Democrat, had won election to the Senate  a victory that for Mr. McConnell spelled both bad news and good news.

title: Harvey Weinstein Is My Monster Too
description: He threatened to shut down Frida if I didnt comply with his demands.

title: In the N.F.L., Stability Comes With a $200 Million Price Tag
description: IRVING, Tex.  When the N.F.L. owners signed off on Commissioner Roger Goodells five-year extension, two important things happened: Goodell made it clear this would be his last deal with the league, and league owners took a moment to figure out exactly what they will get for the hundreds of millions they have committed to him during the next seven years.

title: New Trailer: The 15:17 to Paris, From Clint Eastwood
description: In 2016, the director Clint Eastwood dramatized the story of an airline pilot who saved a planeload of passengers in Sully, and now hes recreating another real-life onboard rescue in The 15:17 to Paris. But while he cast one of the worlds biggest movie stars, Tom Hanks, as the pilot, this time the filmmaker enlisted the actual Americans who thwarted a 2015 terrorist attack on a European train to play themselves: Anthony Sadler, Alek Skarlatos and Spencer Stone.

title: Putting Out the Broadway Welcome Mat in Song
description: With tickets to certain musicals going for sums in the high three figures  and dont forget the long, snaking lines even to get in the door  Broadway audiences surely deserve a little extra acknowledgment.

title: Republican Tax Bill in Final Sprint Across Finish Line
description: WASHINGTON  The day after suffering a political blow in the Alabama special Senate election, congressional Republicans sped forward with the most sweeping tax rewrite in decades, announcing an agreement on a final bill that would cut taxes for businesses and individuals and signal the partys first major legislative achievement since assuming political control this year.

title: Temperatures in Alaska Were So High That Computers Said No Way
description: Average air temperatures were so high last month at a monitoring station on the north coast of Alaska that computers rejected the readings as flawed. But there was nothing wrong with the data or the instrument that recorded it. Rather, temperatures had soared because of shrinking sea ice in the Arctic Ocean, one of the more obvious effects of climate change.

title: Q&A: Holiday Charitable Giving and Taxes
description: Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard are taking reader questions about tax implications and charitable giving.

title: Listen to Bangsokol: A Requiem for Cambodia
description: An excerpt from the Melbourne Festival in 2017.

title: The Year in Stuff
description: It was a year that felt like a decade: 2017 saw the arrival of a new president (and an at-the-ready resistance movement), the unsealing of long-held silences on abuse and consent, a radically new world order and a terrifying spate of natural and human-made disasters (fire, water, terror).

title: Can Aaron Rodgers Get the Packers to the Playoffs?
description: Aaron Rodgers is back. But is it too late for his Green Bay Packers?

title: Valhalla, N.Y.: A Picturesque Hamlet with a Short Commute
description: For a hamlet named after the eternal banquet hall where the slain warriors of Norse mythology caroused, Valhalla is low on drama. Residents appreciate the forested hills, compact homes and soothing cul-de-sacs of this small Westchester community (population 3,400). The schools are excellent, and the commute  about 45 minutes by train to Grand Central Terminal  is short and direct.

title: Small, Quaint and Anything but Ordinary
description: A picturesque Westchester hamlet, Valhalla, N.Y., is quiet, forested and mostly residential, with a large reservoir and a historic dam.

title: Right and Left React to Roy Moores Defeat in Alabama
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: The Best Live Jazz Performances of 2017
description: Jazz seemed to be all over the place this year, a big tent for multimedia mixing, vociferous protest and challenges to the standard definitions of a performers role. Here are 10 outstanding concert experiences  nine in New York, and one in Newport, R.I., where jazzs mainstream goes each summer to take its temperature.

title: Chris Froome Tests Positive, and Cycling History Repeats Itself
description: Admit it: You had a feeling it would happen. I had a feeling it would happen.

title: Anthony Harvey, Lion in Winter Director and Kubrick Editor, Dies at 87
description: It might have gone down as the most ridiculous scene in the most audacious film that Anthony Harvey ever worked on, but  at least as Mr. Harvey told the story  a momentous event in the real world kept it from the moviegoing public.

title: 5 Offbeat Communities: Micronationalists, Mildly Offensive Fiber Artists and More
description: From Reddit chats to Facebook groups, people are finding common passions across borders, languages and nationalities.  We are hiring reporters who can shed light on these underground communities that have taken root in our digital age. But first, we asked our readers what kinds of subcultures they belong to, and what they think is worth covering. Below are edited excerpts from interviews with them.

title: Clarence Beavers, Last of a Black Paratroop Unit, Dies at 96
description: Clarence Beavers, the last surviving member of a groundbreaking group of black paratroopers deployed during World War II against what were described as the worlds first intercontinental-range airborne weapons  giant bomb-laden balloons launched from Japan and aimed at North America  died on Dec. 4 at his home in Huntington, N.Y. He was 96.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: Yes, President Donald Trump has sexually harassed women. This concludes my ethics investigation.

description: Since Harvey Weinsteins unraveling, the list of cultural heavy-hitters accused of sexual misconduct has been growing at a dizzying clip, particularly in Hollywood.

description: WASHINGTON  Heres a new way to fight back attempts to spread fake news: file a police report.

title: New Trailer: Annihilation, Starring Natalie Portman
description: Back in September, Paramount released a teaser for its sci-fi drama Annihilation that focused on Natalie Portmans character, a biologist, leading an all-female team into a jungle populated with dangerous otherworldly creatures. Now a new trailer emphasizes the storys emotional underpinning.

title: Scam I Am: Why Is the G.O.P. Rushing This Tax Abomination?
description: So, it seems that Republicans are responding to the devastating defeat in Alabama  which is part of a sustained pattern of underperformance in special elections, demonstrating that bad polls reflect reality, not bad polling, by  doubling down on a massively unpopular tax plan, whose main focus is on cutting corporate taxes.

title: The Lives They Loved: Submit Your Memories
description: As part of the magazines annual The Lives They Lived issue, we invite readers to contribute a photograph and a story of a loved one who died this year. A number of submissions will be chosen to be published on The New York Times Magazine website. Entries are limited to 400 words and must be submitted by Dec. 31, 2017, to be eligible for consideration.

title: Why Turnout Shifts in Alabama Bode Well for Democrats
description: Over the last eight years, political analysts had come to think that Democrats were at a distinct disadvantage in midterm elections, since their younger and nonwhite coalition was less likely to turn out than older and white voters.

title: How the Fed Rate Increase Affects Your Mortgage, Car Loan and Credit Card Bill
description: The Federal Reserves decision to raise its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday, the fifth increase since the financial crisis, will probably reach beyond Wall Street and into most American homes.

title: Why the Fed Raised Rates (for a Fifth Time)
description: As expected, the Federal Reserve on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate to a range between 1.25 percent and 1.5 percent. It is the fifth rate increase as the Fed continues to retreat from its economic stimulus campaign. It is almost certainly the last change in monetary policy on Janet Yellen's watch as chair.

title: Alabama, Google, North Korea: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: With a Little Help From Their Friends (and Agents and Librarians and Fact-Checkers ...)
description: I love the acknowledgments sections of books. I love what they say and what they do not say. I love what they accidentally say. I love the ways families are discussed, and how the truth about the wretchedness of book-writing finally comes tumbling out, and the combination of neuroticism and relief, pride and latent terror.

title: Review: Trisha Brown Company Is Back, in Witty, Delicate Glory
description: For a troupe that recently went on what was sometimes billed as a farewell tour, or at least as the end of something, the Trisha Brown Dance Company does not look as if it were going gently into any good night. The program that the group presented at the Joyce Theater on Tuesday is exactly the kind that it was supposed to be phasing out: a repertory sampler in a proscenium theater. Would that all broken promises were so wonderful.

title: Review: Philharmonic Replies to $50 Million With Hallelujah
description: Perhaps not every member of the New York Philharmonic is thrilled at the annual prospect of Handels Messiah, and you can partly understand why. As often as not these days, a sharply reduced contingent of 30 or so players will be commandeered by an early-music specialist who will try to reshape their style and sound, at least for the moment  requesting, for example, that the strings rein in their rich vibrato.

title: Walmart Will Let Its 1.4 Million Workers Take Their Pay Before Payday
description: For decades, Walmart has taken heat for how it treats its work force, including paying low wages and creating unpredictable schedules. Now, the giant retailer is trying to ease some of its workers financial strain, allowing them to receive wages before their next payday.

title: Is Christmas a Religious Holiday? A Growing Number of Americans Say No
description: Combatants in the annual War on Christmas have some new data to chew on, thanks to a survey released this week by the Pew Research Center.

title: The Most-Read Food Stories of 2017
description: An updated list of the most popular stories from the Food section this year.

title: White House Corrects Tillerson on Whether U.S. Will Talk to North Korea
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump and Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson are once again at odds over how to deal with nuclear-armed North Korea after Mr. Tillerson declared on Tuesday that the United States was ready to open talks with the North without precondition.

title: Unjustifiable Alarm About Contraceptives
description: To the Editor:

title: Muslim Leaders Declare East Jerusalem the Palestinian Capital
description: ISTANBUL  Leaders and officials of Muslim nations declared East Jerusalem the Palestinian capital on Wednesday at a summit meeting in Istanbul, producing the strongest response yet to President Trumps decision to recognize the city as Israels capital.

title: A Cavernous Indie Music Club Opens in Brooklyn
description: New York night owls have hooted for years that the wildest, weirdest after-dark scenes have flourished somewhere else. But recent developments, like the creation of an Office of Nightlife and the repeal of the anti-dancing Cabaret Law, offer hope that the dark era of club raids and closings (R.I.P. 285 Kent, Death by Audio and so many others) is in the past.

title: Why You Should Love Secondhand Fashion Now
description: The following is a real story about the RealReal, a luxury consignment start-up that now has a brick-and-mortar store in SoHo. A few months ago, a friend walked into an intimate gathering wearing a daisy print Cline skirt. One of our mutual friends said to her, I saw that on the RealReal. Another said, Oh, Im so happy you were the one who got it. This is perhaps how billionaires chat after a Sothebys auction, which is not the camaraderie and pride one would expect to hear about secondhand shopping.

title: Doug Jones: From Prosecuting K.K.K. Members to the Senate
description: Senator-Elect Doug Jones of Alabama made a name for himself prosecuting two Ku Klux Klan members for a church bombing that killed four black girls in 1963. Now, he will become a member of the U.S. Senate.

title: More Victims of the California Wildfires: Avocados and Lemons
description: LOS ANGELES  The fire that rampaged through the Brokaw Ranch in Ventura County last week was fast, furious and unstoppable, driven by winds gusting at 70 miles an hour.

title: Lost in Penn Station? Amtrak Has an App to Guide You
description: Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan is such a confusing, multilevel maze of corridors lined with pizza parlors and coffee shops that even veteran commuters occasionally get lost.

title: The Great Red Spot Descends Deep Into Jupiter
description: NEW ORLEANS  Jupiter's Great Red Spot is not just a skin-deep beauty mark.

title: U.S. at a Crossroad as It Confronts Turmoil in Honduras
description: MEXICO CITY  Protests snaking through city streets, nighttime curfews, a raucous political battle over a presidents re-election: Honduras has been seized by a crisis since a disputed  vote last month.

title: The Biggest Tech Failures and Successes of 2017
description: Lets face it: Technology this year was one big fail after another. And the biggest loser from all of this was you.

title: Out of the Batcave and Into the Bronx
description: In comics, Batman was born in Crime Alley, when Bruce Wayne saw the lives of his parents come to an end during a robbery gone wrong.

title: Monitor's Report on Police Stops in New York
description: A report from the monitor overseeing the changes in the stop-and-frisk policies of the New York Police Department found that officers still are not documenting encounters.

title: Ajit Pai Nears His Biggest Win With Net Neutrality Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  Small tech companies, consumer groups and many celebrities have been up in arms for weeks about a proposal at the Federal Communications Commission to dismantle landmark rules that guarantee an open internet.

title: Bombing Suspect, in Hospital Bed, Is Ordered Held Without Bail
description: In a brief court appearance held via videoconference from a hospital room, the Brooklyn man accused of detonating a homemade pipe bomb inside a crowded subway tunnel in Manhattan was ordered held without bail on Wednesday by a federal magistrate judge.

title: Black Voters to Democrats: Youre Welcome
description: The first election I can remember was the race between George H. W. Bush and Michael Dukakis in 1988. Dressed in footie pajamas, I stayed up late with my political die-hard parents. They tried and failed to avoid swearing as the map on television turned red.

title: Scenes of Holiday Lights in New York
description: Welcome to wintertime, full of fir trees and colorful light bulbs.

title: New York City, Illuminated for the Holidays
description: Wintertime has, at long last, arrived in the Big Apple  and with it, elaborate window displays, slow-moving shoppers, those giant red Christmas-tree ornaments on Sixth Avenue, Bryant Park ice-skaters and (of course) fir trees and colorful light bulbs galore. See all of this and more in our slide show.

title: City Police Officers Are Not Reporting All Street Stops, Monitor Says
description: More than two years into his tenure, a court-appointed monitor overseeing changes to the New York Police Departments stop-and-frisk policies has found that some officers are still failing to document the encounters as required, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Sasheer Zamata Reads Was I on a Date or Babysitting?
description: On this weeks podcast, the actress and comedian Sasheer Zamata reads Was I on a Date or Babysitting? In it Julie Klausner shares her story of playing second banana to a musicians young son and his guitar and everything else in his life.

title: In Myanmars Divided Villages, Fear Prevails and Life Has Stopped
description: GENEVA  Just a few hundred yards separate two villages at the northern end of Rakhine State in Myanmar, but after a brutal crackdown by security forces in August, a deep chasm of fear now divides the Muslim residents of one from the non-Muslims in the other.

title: Chrissy Metz Will Make Her Stage Debut in Fat Pig
description: Chrissy Metz, a breakout star of NBCs This is Us, will make her stage debut in an updated version of Neil LaButes Fat Pig in Los Angeles in May.

title: The 25 Best Classical Music Recordings of 2017
description: Music writers spend their days guiltily staring down literally dozens of unheard new recordings that pile up as the year goes on, with more coming in each day. So it has been an arduous and frustrating but also inspiring and illuminating exercise to narrow our favorites down to five each, for a list of 25 gorgeous releases that covers a huge amount of chronological and stylistic ground.

title: A Game Changer for Patients With Irregular Heart Rhythm
description: The patients were gravely ill, their hearts scarred by infections or heart attacks. In each, the electrical system that maintains a regular heartbeat had been short-circuited.

title: Down an Internet Rabbit Hole With an Artist as Your Guide
description: Every art organization aims to get visitors in the door, but thats not enough. Museums and galleries increasingly seek to connect with audiences well beyond their walls  leading them to grapple for attention on Facebook and YouTube, wherever eyeballs can be reached.

title: Vera Katz, Mayor Who Oversaw Portlands Flowering, Dies at 84
description: Vera Katz, a refugee from Nazi Germany and a former Brooklynite who became a feminist force in Oregon and a three-term mayor of its largest city, Portland, as it grew from an unremarkable port and timber town into a liberal bastion of visionary urban planning, died on Monday at her home in Southwest Portland. She was 84.

title: 3 Chill-Proof Party Looks
description: The party gods were not kind when they determined to make the coldest months of the year the most jam-packed with festivities. Luckily, the fashion gods have been more charitable this season, bestowing plenty of festive options that will keep us relatively toasty. Here, three suggested party looks, and how to wear them.

title: Vancouver Man Who Promised Riches to Investors Committed Fraud, Panel Says
description: In a case that highlights Canadas struggle to quash financial crime, a prominent immigration consultant and political donor in Vancouvers wealthy Chinese community has been found to have committed fraud, the British Columbia Securities Commission announced on Wednesday.

title: Aharon Leib Shteinman, Ultra-Orthodox Leader in Israel, Dies at 104
description: Rabbi Aharon Leib Shteinman, a revered figure in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish world whose influence was keenly felt when he reluctantly went along with Israels military conscription of adherents who were not in full-time yeshiva study, died on Tuesday in a hospital in Bnei Brak, Israel. He was 104.

title: The Strongmen Whove Started Blaming Fake News Too
description: President Trumps use of the phrase fake news has gone global  particularly among authoritarian governments.

title: A Fox Deal Would Test Disney
description: Disneys chief Mouseketeer is about to face his biggest test. The $160 billion media conglomerate is close to striking a deal to acquire parts of Rupert Murdochs Fox empire, pegged at $60 billion by CNBC. Some would be an odd fit, and regulators may not like Disney expanding in sports and movies. Boss Bob Iger has his work cut out.

title: Music Mogul Russell Simmons Is Accused of Rape by 3 Women
description: In 1995, Drew Dixon was working her dream job as an executive at Def Jam Recordings, helping to oversee a chart-topping album and a ubiquitous single by Method Man and Mary J. Blige. But as her star rose, Ms. Dixon, then 24, was spiraling into depression, she said, because of prolonged and aggressive sexual harassment by her direct supervisor, Russell Simmons, the rap mogul and co-founder of the label.

title: Russell Simmonss Statement on Rape Allegations
description: Russell Simmons released a statement to The New York Times in response to four women who accused him of violent sexual behavior, including three who accused him of rape. In his statement, Mr. Simmons denied the accusations.

title: Alabama, White House, Janet Yellen: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: On the Clock
description: Dear Diary:

title: Strong Demand for Health Insurance as Deadline Looms
description: WASHINGTON  More than one million people signed up last week for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act, pushing the total in the federal marketplace to nearly 4.7 million, the Trump administration said Wednesday, days before the annual enrollment period is scheduled to end.

title: Video of Shark Being Dragged by Boat Leads to Arrest of Three
description: A 10-second video showing a blacktip shark being dragged behind a speedboat has led to the arrest of three men on charges of aggravated animal cruelty, Florida prosecutors said this week.

title: How 22,800 Write-In Votes Changed the Alabama Senate Election
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  As supporters of Roy S. Moore on Wednesday sifted the results of his stunning loss in Alabama, one number jumped out: About 22,800 write-in votes were cast, more than the gap separating Mr. Moore, the scandal-plagued Republican, from the victorious Doug Jones, the first Democratic senator elected in the state in a quarter-century.

title: A Routine Run In, Except for the Senator in the Passenger Seat
description: But for two small details, the run-in between a bicyclist and two men in a car on Monday evening would most likely have gone unremarked, just another entry in the annals of asphalt warfare in New York City.

title: Trumps Shameless Slur Against Kirsten Gillibrand
description: In the fall of 1987, a Nashville woman named Teresa Harris decided shed had enough of her bosss harassment and quit.

title: How the Tide Turned Against Roy Moore in Alabama
description: Analysis of the U.S. Senate election results, both statewide and broken down by key counties and voter groups.

title: Getting in a Holiday Frame of Mind
description: Here comes the sun. For all those returning Art Basel snowbirds, Saks Fifth Avenue is bringing a little bit of South Florida to Manhattan. On Thursday, it will open a pop-up for the Miami Beach concept store Alchemist with an installation by the artist Awol Erizku. Expect boilers and synthetic flowers and a range of lifestyle products, including a reversible dip-dye tee ($425) and acid-washed Baja ($450) with Mr. Erizkus artwork.

title: Can the Weather Make Bones and Joints Ache?
description: Fact or old wives tale? A change in the weather can make bones and joints ache. A new study has an answer: old wives tale.

title: Eight Candidates Approved for U.S. Soccer Presidential Race
description: The crowded field of candidates running for the presidency of U.S. Soccer was trimmed on Wednesday night, but only barely.

title: Cuomo Takes Ungainly Dip Into Sexual Harassment Debate
description: ALBANY  Amid the ongoing national reckoning over sexual harassment, New Yorks junior senator, Kirsten Gillibrand, has been front and center in the debate, denouncing the unsavory actions of powerful men in all walks of life, from President Trump to fellow Democratic senators like Al Franken.

title: Republican Tax Bill Overhauls Rules Many Were Counting On
description: WASHINGTON  Before pursuing a doctoral degree in art history, Rachael Vause determined that a tuition waiver, a $22,500 stipend and the ability to deduct the interest on her previous graduate school loans would allow her to enroll in a four-year program at the University of Delaware.

title: Irish Lawmakers Recommend Repealing Strict Abortion Ban
description: DUBLIN  An Irish parliamentary committee on Wednesday recommended that a constitutional ban on abortion be repealed, paving the way for the liberalization of one of the worlds strictest abortion laws.

title: Salma Hayek: Harvey Weinstein Is My Monster Too
description: Harvey Weinstein was a passionate cinephile, a risk taker, a patron of talent in film, a loving father and a monster.

title: Should Australia Treat China as Friend or Foe?
description: Damien Cave, our Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this weekly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: Uber Under Criminal Investigation, Justice Dept. Confirms in Letter to Court
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Federal investigators are pursuing at least one criminal investigation into Uber, according to a court document released on Wednesday.

title: Anthony Scaduto, an Early Biographer of Dylan, Dies at 85
description: Anthony Scaduto, a journalist and author who wrote the first serious biography of Bob Dylan and an investigative book contending that Bruno Richard Hauptmann was wrongly executed in the kidnapping of Charles Lindberghs baby, died on Tuesday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 85.

title: Parliament Demands Greater Say Over Brexit, Defying Theresa May
description: LONDON  Britains Parliament voted narrowly on Wednesday to demand a decisive say over the countrys plans to withdraw from the European Union, dealing an unexpected defeat to Prime Minister Theresa May, who had asked for maximum leeway to negotiate with Brussels on untangling decades of integration with the Continent.

title: Alabama Women Make a Stand in First Election of the #MeToo Era
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  For Janet Maycock, Tuesdays election of the Democrat Doug Jones in Alabama was personal.

title: Genocide Survivors Compose a Requiem for Cambodia
description: Rithy Panh, a survivor of the Cambodian genocide under the Khmer Rouge, takes issue with the philosopher Theodor Adornos famous claim that to write poetry after Auschwitz is barbaric.

title: The Omen of Alabama
description: The political winds are shifting with all the subtlety of a hurricane.

title: Trumps Revisionist History of His Role in Alabama Race
description: After a Democrat prevailed in a special Senate election in Alabama, a ruby-red Republican state, President Trump offered on Wednesday a truncated and misleading account of his role in the race.

title: Joe Biden Comforts Meghan McCain in Heartfelt Exchange on The View
description: It lasted only a short time, and it hardly eclipsed the bitterness of partisan politics that has consumed the country. But for nearly five minutes on Wednesday morning, Joe Biden and Meghan McCain shared an emotional exchange about the aggressive form of brain cancer that has affected both of their families.

title: Pat DiNizio, Singer and Songwriter for the Smithereens, Dies at 62
description: Pat DiNizio, the songwriter and lead singer for the durable New Jersey rock n roll band the Smithereens, whose melodic, guitar-heavy songs like Blood and Roses and A Girl Like You attracted a loyal following, died on Tuesday in Summit, N.J. He was 62.

title: Michael Pineda, a Yankees Enigma, Signs a Two-Year Deal With the Twins
description: Michael Pineda arrived to the Yankees with a bum shoulder and will leave the club with a mending elbow, having signed a two-year, $10 million deal with the Minnesota Twins on Wednesday.

title: Rerouting Thousands: City Plans for L Train Closure
description: No single- or two-passenger cars on the Williamsburg Bridge during the morning or afternoon rush. A new ferry route. Extra turnstiles in some Brooklyn subway stations. The packed lanes of 14th Street in Manhattan given over solely to buses. Twice as many bicyclists whizzing over the East River from Brooklyn.

title: Netflix Executive Loses Job After Comment on Danny Masterson Rape Allegations
description: On the sidelines of a childrens soccer game in Los Angeles this month, a Netflix executive reportedly told a woman that people at the company did not believe the rape allegations against Danny Masterson, an actor who was starring in the series The Ranch.

title: AT&T Agrees to Contract, and Union Backs Time Warner Deal
description: Stemming the tide of rising economic insecurity for service workers, a major union has won significant job protection and increased pay for about 20,000 AT&T wireless employees, as well as a commitment to bring work back from overseas.

title: The Global Economy Is Partying Like Its 2008
description: In late 2008, at a meeting with academics at the London School of Economics, Queen Elizabeth II  asked why no one seemed to have anticipated the worlds worst financial crisis in the postwar period. The so-called Great Recession, which had begun in late 2008 and would run until mid-2009, was set off by the sudden collapse of sky-high prices for housing and other assets  something that is obvious in retrospect but that, nevertheless, no one seemed to see coming.

title: When the Peoples Lawyer Breaks the Law
description: The renegade Rensselaer County, N.Y., district attorney, Joel Abelove, showed his contempt for the law and his unworthiness to hold office last year, when he brazenly obstructed a state investigation of a fatal shooting by a police officer in Troy. A grand jury indictment unsealed this month, charging him with perjury and official misconduct, makes a strong case for removing Mr. Abelove from office. Removal proceedings against elected officials in New York State are rare.

title: Voices From Alabama: Black Women Who Voted for Doug Jones
description: Exit polling shows 98 percent of female African-American voters supported Doug Jones in the Senate election in Alabama. We spoke to some of them to learn what was so important to them in this election.

title: The Pentagon Is Not a Sacred Cow
description: Health care, Social Security, Medicare and other social programs are all on the chopping block as the Republican-led Congress scrambles to make up for the revenue lost to its planned tax cuts. The Pentagon, however, remains a sacred cow, destined to receive yet more money.

title: Trumps E.P.A. Chemical Safety Nominee Withdraws
description: President Trumps nominee to oversee the Environmental Protection Agencys chemical safety division on Wednesday withdrew his name from consideration for the post in the face of mounting opposition.

title: No, Mr. Trump, Torture Doesnt Work
description: In one of his first acts as president, Barack Obama signed executive orders closing this countrys secret prisons overseas, banning torture and authorizing an end to the detention camp at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. Obviously, Mr. Obama didnt fully get his way. Guantnamo, though reduced to a few dozen prisoners, is still operating. And the current president has expressed full faith in the harsh methods described euphemistically as enhanced interrogation techniques. Dont tell me it doesnt work  torture works, Donald Trump insisted during the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: Derek Jeter Was Once the Captain. But Now Hes the Apprentice.
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  In Derek Jeters first professional season, he batted .210. In his second season, he made 56 errors. In his third season, he was Baseball Americas Minor League Player of the Year. You know the rest.

title: After Police Raid Kills Man, 69, Family Asks Why Trigger Was Pulled
description: It was around 4 a.m. on Dec. 5 when Natalio Conde woke to the sound of men moving through his railroad apartment on Brook Avenue in the Bronx. He was frightened. Ninety-two years old and in fragile health, he knew he was no match for intruders.

title: Mets Find Some Help for Their Beleaguered Bullpen
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  One of the biggest disappointments for the Mets last season  and there were many  was how poorly their pitching staff performed. An injured and underwhelming starting rotation put extra strain on a very imperfect bullpen.

title: Alabama Loss Exposes Republican Fissures Amid a Democratic Surge
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  The once-unimaginable Republican defeat in Alabamas special Senate election on Tuesday tore open divisions between the partys establishment and populist wings, inciting bitter recriminations in the Republican Party as Democratic enthusiasm surges  especially in the nations cities and affluent suburbs.

title: Correspondence With Chemical Industry
description: Emails sent or received by Michael L. Dourson and his team that show regular interaction with chemical industry officials even after he learned he was to be nominated for a key E.P.A. post.

title: Quotation of the Day: Three Allege Music Mogul Raped Them
description: It was exhausting. It was like making a record while swimming in rough seas.

title: Donald Trumps Gift to Women
description: On the day before the Alabama election, I found myself explaining that I needed to get to work despite the bombing at my subway station because there were women coming in to talk about having been sexually assaulted by the president.

title: The Legacy of Simeon Booker, a Pioneer of Civil Rights Journalism
description: The African-American journalist Simeon S. Booker Jr., who died this week at the age of 99, sensed an important story when Emmett Till, a black 14-year-old from Chicago, was lynched and mutilated during a summer visit to Mississippi in 1955 for supposedly flirting with a white woman.

title: Tavis Smiley Responds to PBS Suspension of Talk Show After Misconduct Allegations
description: PBS stopped distributing a talk show hosted by Tavis Smiley on Wednesday after an investigation found credible allegations of misconduct against him, the network announced.

title: Tricky Situation
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  I approach the Thursday puzzle each week with a maximum expectation for shenanigans. I know therell be a theme, often one so intricate and well-crafted that a solver can be forgiven for following the wrong threads for miles, since constructors like Timothy Polin here can work their creative wiles and dream up any manner of groundbreaking innovation. Wink wink.

title: Kentucky Lawmaker Kills Himself Amid Sexual Assault Allegations, Officials Say
description: A Kentucky state representative accused of molesting a teenage girl killed himself on Wednesday, just two days after the allegations were made public, the authorities said.

title: Corrections: December 14, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Mr. Robot Season 3 Finale: Reveals, Reversals and Reconciliations
description: The frenetic Season 3 finale of Mr. Robot was thick with reveals, reversals and reconciliations, and left no tone unturned as it cycled through suspense and tragedy, high melodrama and horror spectacle. (Heeeres Irving!) The final shot  not counting the post-credits stinger  struck an optimistic note as Elliot consummated the seasons radical reset theme by handing E Corp the keys to undoing the 5/9 hack.

title: Europes Central Bank, Lagging Behind Counterparts, Faces Eventful 2018
description: FRANKFURT  A lot is happening in the world of central banks.

title: In Japan, Haiku on the Rocks
description: On a cold and rainy night earlier this year, I found myself at Hoyaken, a matchbook-size bar in Matsuyama, a city in the southwest corner of Shikoku, the least visited of Japans four main islands.

title: Marijuana and Vaping Are More Popular Than Cigarettes Among Teenagers
description: Cigarette smoking has dropped so sharply among American teenagers that vaping and marijuana use are now more common, according to a national survey of adolescent drug use released Thursday.

title: Casualties Surge From Land Mines and Improvised Explosives
description: Casualties from land mines and similar booby-trap explosives increased for the second consecutive year in 2016, to the highest level since a treaty banning such weapons of war took effect in 1999, a monitoring group said Thursday.

title: Brexit, Salma Hayek, Alabama: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The New Supermodelmania of 2017
description: One night last September, an event took place during Milan Fashion Week that reverberated far beyond the catwalks. It was the finale of the Versace show, a tribute by the creative director Donatella Versace to the work of her murdered brother, Gianni, the founder of the house, and it involved five of his favorite models of the early 1990s  Claudia Schiffer, Naomi Campbell, Carla Bruni Sarkozy, Helena Christensen and Cindy Crawford  posed in a tableau from yesteryear, and then in full runway strut. People in the audience clutched their cellphones in an ecstasy of frenetic posting.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Jingle Ball and Con Air
description: Taylor Swift performs at Jingle Ball following an album release. And Amy Sherman-Palladinos Bunheads arrives on Hulu.

title: Indonesian Constitutional Court Declines to Ban Sex Outside Marriage
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesias Constitutional Court on Thursday narrowly rejected a petition asking it to criminalize all sex outside marriage, in a blow to religious conservatives who have been gaining influence in the secular, Muslim-majority country.

title: Word + Quiz: boorish
A Smarter Way to Clean Up After Your Big Party
description: So youve thrown your annual holiday party, and it was a smashing success! Your guests took down the twinkle lights and turned themselves into human chandeliers, you roasted (and consumed) a whole pig tail and all, and your signature pomegranate-champagne punch was a huge hit. (Just ask Sandra  shes sleeping off the punch down in your rec room, by the way.)

title: Rainbow
description: What is this image saying about 2017? How does it relate to and comment on the events of this year? What do you think of its message?

title: A Look at the Heart-Wrenching Moments From Equal Rights Battles
description: All the major battles for equal rights  racial, ethnic, gender, sexual orientation, disability  are explored in The Good Fight.

title: Teaching Activities for: Jay-Z and Dean Baquet, in Conversation
description: Before reading the article:

title: A Look at the Heart-Wrenching Moments From Equal Rights Battles
description: The 54-mile march for voting rights from Selma to Alabamas state capital, Montgomery, took more than good legs and sturdy shoes. It took defying the police, who ambushed hundreds of men, women and children  on a bridge named for a Klu Klux Klan leader  and beat them bloody. It took a court order and it took journalists covering the struggles to tell and shock the world.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Indian Butterscotch Ice Cream
description: Travelers in India who are not searching for themselves often instead come searching for culinary transcendence. The possible food quests are endless, something Ive learned over the course of repeat reporting trips to the country, and I visited Delhi in October with an agenda of my own. I looked forward to local delicacies, like chhole bhature, a fried-bread-and-chickpea breakfast, and daulat ki chaat, sweetened milk froth with pistachios and cardamon. But there was one food I anticipated more than any other, a taste I had been craving since I first visited India a year before. It was then, on an impossibly humid day in Bangalore, that I sought relief in the freezer box of a local shop and found that is was full of butterscotch ice cream cones.

title: The Secrets of Russian Honey Cake, Revealed
description: When Michelle Polzine opened 20th Century Cafe, a tiny pastry shop in San Francisco in 2013, her majestic Russian honey cake enchanted sweet tooths everywhere.
